0.title: Kuldeep executed it well vs Stoinis and he's only going to get better: Boult
0.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult praised his fellow pacer Kuldeep Sen for defending 15 runs in the final over against LSG, stating that the 25-year-old is only going to get better in the upcoming games. "Kuldeep executed it well [against Marcus Stoinis]," stated Boult. With Marcus Stoinis on strike, Kuldeep bowled three dot balls and conceded only 11 in final over.

1.title: Nadabet project will give employment to 5 lakh youth in 10 years: Amit Shah
1.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Gujarat's Nadabet, said the pilot project will provide employment to over five lakh youth in next 10 years. "I pay my homage to PM Narendra Modi's vision for he had come up with the idea of a multidimensional project for Nadabet," Shah added.

2.title: Hong Kong Customs seizes record methamphetamine haul worth ₹387 cr
2.article_body: Hong Kong Customs said on Sunday that it has seized a record haul of methamphetamine worth HK$400 million (approximately ₹387 cr) and arrested two men in the matter. About 447 kg of the suspected drug was hidden in three transformers, while the rest was found at a logistics warehouse in 10 pieces of industrial-use anti-vibratory rubber, it added.

3.title: Big B reunites with co-star Nafisa Ali for Uunchai; fan says 'Beautiful jodi'
3.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan reunited with his 'Major Saab' co-star Nafisa Ali Sodhi for his upcoming project 'Uunchai'. The two played a married couple in the 1998 film which also starred Ajay Devgn. Sharing pictures with Amitabh, Nafisa wrote, "My...handsome, amazing man...and adorable co-star Amitabh Bachchan." She also shared a throwback picture of them from 'Major Saab', and wrote, "How time flies."

4.title: Unfortunate that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files': Pawar
4.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said it is "unfortunate" that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files' movie. "An individual made a movie (The Kashmir Files) showing atrocities on Hindus," Pawar added. "It depicted that in Kashmir, the Hindu Pandits were minorities and they were driven out during VP Singh-led government which was supported by BJP," Pawar stated.

5.title: Mysterious creature with human-like lips washes up on Australian beach, pic surfaces
5.article_body: A mysterious creature with human-like lips washed up on Bondi Beach in Australia. A jogger posted a video on Facebook of the creature and asked people to help him identify it. The jogger said that the animal appeared to be nearly half a metre long and had lips like a human and skin like a shark.

6.title: Musk tweets emoji with hand on mouth after Twitter CEO says he won't join Board
6.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a laughing emoji with hand on mouth on Twitter about an hour after Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Musk has decided not to join its Board. Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, later deleted the tweet. Agrawal said that Twitter will value input from its shareholders, whether or not they are on the Board.

7.title: 1 killed, another injured in Gujarat during clashes amid Ram Navami procession
7.article_body: One person died and another sustained injuries after communal clashes broke out in Gujarat's Khambhat during a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. "The body of an unidentified man, who appears to be aged around 65 years, was recovered from the spot...where two groups pelted stones at each other," an officer said. A few shop cabins were also set on fire.

8.title: 29-yr-old man dies after being hit by BEST bus in Mumbai, driver held
8.article_body: An employee at an IT company was killed after allegedly being hit by a BEST bus in Mumbai's Mankhurd area. The driver was arrested but was later granted bail by a magistrate court, police said. The deceased Karan Dumbre (29) was going to his home on his motorcycle when the accident took place, officials from the Trombay Police Station said.

9.title: Bank manager among 4 held for stealing valuables worth ₹2.5 cr from lockers in UP
9.article_body: Four persons, including a bank manager, were arrested in connection with an alleged theft of valuables worth over ₹2.5 crore from the lockers of the Central Bank of India's Karachi Khana branch in Kanpur, police said on Sunday. Stolen ornaments weighing 342 grams have been recovered from the accused, Deputy Commissioner of Police (East), Pramod Kumar, said.

10.title: Wanted Sarfaraz for the end, that's why we sent Axar, Shardul over him: Pant
10.article_body: On being asked why Sarfaraz Khan wasn't sent in to bat after the fall of the fifth wicket against KKR, DC captain Rishabh Pant said they wanted the 24-year-old for the end of the innings. "We wanted momentum to keep going...we knew [even] if we lost wickets...we'd have Sarfaraz...and that's why we sent Axar and Shardul over him," explained Pant.

11.title: Ram Navami processions attacked in Howrah, Bankura: WB leaders
11.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Sunday alleged that a Ram Navami procession was attacked by police in Howrah, saying, "Can't Sanatani devotees practice their religion in this state safely?" In another incident, Union Minister and state Lok Sabha MP Subhas Sarkar also claimed that a Ram Navami procession and his car were pelted with stones in Bankura.

12.title: Sec 144 imposed in village in J'khand's Lohardaga after communal violence
12.article_body: Communal clashes were reported in at least two districts of Jharkhand during Ram Navami processions on Sunday evening. In view of incidents of stone-pelting and arson, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Hirdi village of Lohardaga district, Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Arbind Kumar Lal said. Another instance of communal violence was reported in Bermo area of Bokaro district.

13.title: Queen Elizabeth II chats with COVID patients, staff at UK hospital
13.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II paid a virtual visit to a hospital in London and interacted with COVID-19 patients, doctors and nurses. The event marked the official opening of the Queen Elizabeth Unit, a critical care facility housing 155 beds. "It [COVID-19] does leave one very tired and exhausted, doesn't it?" the Queen told a couple recovering from the infection.

14.title: I once took up the role of Sita in Ramlila: Ravi Kishan
14.article_body: Actor-politician Ravi Kishan has said that he struggled for many years and played a lot of roles before achieving some level of success. He added that he even took up the role of Sita in Ramlila "for the sake of pursuing [his] passion for acting". Ravi further said his father didn't support him initially but his mother always supported him.

15.title: A RRRemarkable milestone: Ajay as 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-cr mark globally
15.article_body: After 'RRR' crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark at the global box office, Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to congratulate the team of the action-drama film. "A RRRemarkable Milestone! Congratulations to the entire team of #RRR for a record-breaking run at box office," Ajay, who played a character named Venkata Rama Raju in the film, wrote. 'RRR' was released on March 25.

16.title: Lakhs of people come out in streets in support of Imran Khan in Pakistan
16.article_body: Lakhs of people across Pakistan came out in streets in support of ousted PM Imran Khan on Sunday. Khan tweeted a video from Lahore and wrote, "Never have such crowds come out so spontaneously and in such numbers in our history, rejecting the imported govt led by crooks." Protests also took place in Karachi, Peshawar, Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Abbottabad.

17.title: Macron to face Marine Le Pen in presidential election in France
17.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to face candidate Marine Le Pen in the presidential election runoff scheduled to be held on April 24. They emerged as the top two candidates after the first round of voting for the presidential election. Notably, Le Pen has called for banning hijab in public and halal butchers.

18.title: Earlier did some films to make my husband happy; I was like a chamchi: Neetu
18.article_body: Neetu Kapoor revealed earlier she did some films because of her husband, late actor Rishi Kapoor. She said, "There were films that I did with my husband and I was like a chamchi, he'd say 'come and do it'. I wouldn't do it on my own will." "I was doing (all that) trying to make my husband happy," she added.

19.title: War wouldn't have happened if Ukraine was in NATO: Ukraine minister
19.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba during an interview with NBC News said that the war with Russia wouldn't have taken place if the former country was "a member of NATO". He added that the "strategic mistake" by Germany and France in 2008, when they rejected US and its allies' efforts on the same, is "something that Ukraine is paying for".

20.title: Gujarat's education system is crumbling, says Arvind Kejriwal
20.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that the people in Gujarat have begun to question the "crumbling education" system in the state being ruled by BJP for the last 27 years. Kejriwal promised that his party will provide just as "good education" to the students there as it is available in Delhi if voted to power in the upcoming polls.

21.title: Opposition is weak, BJP hammering it through probe agencies: Raut
21.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has accused the BJP-led Centre of "hammering the opposition through central investigative agencies" which already is "weak". "Despite this, the opposition is not ready to surrender," Raut said. "The weak opposition is being hammered...and our HM (Amit) Shah says, they want to see a strong opposition! This joke is interesting," added Raut.

22.title: Muslims offer water bottles in Ram Navami procession in Siliguri
22.article_body: Muslim youths in West Bengal's Siliguri offered water bottles and hugged participants of a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. One of the Muslim volunteers said that they had done so to "foster affection among the people of different communities". "It is a nice gesture that they came forward to greet us on the occasion," a participant of the procession said.

23.title: 6 workers killed as blast at chemical factory triggers fire in Gujarat's Bharuch
23.article_body: Six workers were killed after a blast at a chemical factory in Gujarat's Bharuch district triggered a fire on Monday early morning. Bharuch SP Leena Patil said the victims were working near a reactor, which suddenly exploded during solvent distillation process. "The victims' bodies were later recovered and sent for postmortem. The fire was also brought under control," she added.

24.title: India reports 861 new COVID-19 cases, 6 deaths in 24 hours
24.article_body: India has reported 861 new COVID-19 cases, 929 recoveries and six more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,054 COVID-19 cases and 29 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,058, while the death toll reached 5,21,691.

25.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 20 matches?
25.article_body: After the first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR, KKR, GT, RCB and LSG have accumulated six points each. RR are on top of the table due to a superior net run-rate. GT are the only unbeaten team in the tournament so far, while defending champions CSK and five-time champions MI are yet to win a match.

26.title: 2 arrested for selling adulterated ghee in Delhi
26.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested two people for allegedly selling adulterated ghee. The police said they recovered over 1,200 litres of adulterated ghee in packages of different brands. The matter came to light when a ghee manufacturing firm complained that some people were tampering with packets of the company's original product and adding fake ghee to them.

27.title: Shreyas Iyer's wicket was very important for me: Kuldeep on 4/35 vs KKR
27.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who picked four wickets against KKR during their match on Sunday, has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer's wicket was "personally very important" for him. "Shreyas was batting well and I wanted to make him guess. It was a very big wicket," he added. Apart from Shreyas, Kuldeep dismissed Pat Cummins, Sunil Narine and Umesh Yadav.

28.title: Fire destroys 200 acres of standing wheat crop in Haryana's Karnal
28.article_body: A fire on Sunday destroyed a standing wheat crop spread over 200 acres in Haryana's Karnal, with farmers claiming that the gutted crop and fodder were worth ₹1 crore. Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot and took several hours to put out the blaze. The fire had allegedly broken out due to a spark in the reaper machine.

29.title: IMD predicts relief from heatwave conditions over northwest India from April 12
29.article_body: The IMD has predicted some respite from the ongoing heatwave conditions over northwest India from Tuesday. IMD attributes this to an approaching fresh western disturbance, which will affect the western Himalayan regions from the night of April 12 and bring cooler winds over the heated regions. The maximum temperatures are likely to fall by 2-3°C over parts of northwest India.

30.title: Bihar govt official among 8 held for stealing 60-feet long iron bridge
30.article_body: Bihar Police arrested eight persons including a Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) of the Water Resources Department in connection with the theft of a 60-feet long abandoned bridge in Rohtas, an official said. According to the police, the thieves arrived with JCBs, pickup vans, gas cutters and vehicles and in three days they cut off the entire bridge and disappeared.

31.title: Actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam passes away 2 months after 15-year-old son's demise
31.article_body: Actor-screenwriter Shiv Kumar Subramaniam, who featured in films like '2 States', 'Hichki' and 'Nail Polish', passed away two months after his 15-year-old son's demise. The cause of his death is not known yet. He had started his journey in film industry with writing the screenplay of Vidhu Vinod Chopra's 'Parinda' in 1989, for which he also won a Filmfare Award.

32.title: Elon Musk has decided not to join the Twitter board, says CEO Parag; shares note
32.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal has said that Elon Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, won't join the company's board. Parag shared a brief note he sent to the company, wherein he wrote, "Elon's appointment to the board was to become officially effective 4/9, but Elon shared that same morning that he will no longer be joining the board."

33.title: 10 injured as cable cars in Jharkhand ropeway collide, nearly 50 stuck midair
33.article_body: At least 10 tourists were injured, including two seriously, after some cable cars in a ropeway collided with each other at Trikut hills close to Baba Baidyanath Temple in Jharkhand’s Deoghar district on Sunday, officials said. As per eyewitnesses, 50 people are still stuck in at least 12 cabins in the ropeway and a rescue operation is underway, PTI reported.

34.title: We have this history, we're not getting really good starts: Shreyas Iyer
34.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said their top-order's form is something they need to work on in their upcoming games in IPL 2022. "We have this history...we [aren't] getting really good starts," he stated. Chasing 216 to win against DC, KKR were 43/2 after the powerplay and then lost by 44 runs. This was KKR's second defeat in five games.

35.title: Delhi Metro to bring in advanced scanners at stations in phases
35.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has said that it will install "highly advanced and state-of-the-art baggage scanners at stations in a phased manner". According to officials, 34 advanced scanners were installed under the first phase of the plan and about 250 more of them will be brought in across all metro stations by the end of 2022.

36.title: Students at Pune’s SPPU demand better food, hostel facilities
36.article_body: The students of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) held protests demanding improvement in food quality in the canteens and expansion in hostel accommodations. According to students, the hostel admissions have not started with full capacity due to which they are forced to stay at costlier rented flats. A university official said the students' demands will be looked into.

37.title: Enjoyed De Kock's wicket the most: Chahal on picking 4 wickets vs LSG
37.article_body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who was named Man of the Match for picking four wickets for 41 runs against LSG, has said he enjoyed taking Quinton de Kock's wicket the most in the game. "De Kock could've changed the game," he added. Chahal has now become the purple cap holder with 11 wickets in four games.

38.title: Curfew in 3 areas of MP's Khargone after stones hurled at Ram Navami procession
38.article_body: A curfew has been imposed in three areas, including Talab Chowk and Tavdi, of Madhya Pradesh's Khargone after stones were hurled at a Ram Navami procession on Sunday, which led to clashes and incidents of arson. Police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. Khargone District Collector said Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in the entire city.

39.title: Imran Khan's niece Zayn gives an update on the actor, says 'He is happy'
39.article_body: Former actor Imran Khan's niece Zayn Khan shared an update on him. On Sunday, during an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram, a fan asked Zayn, "What's Imran Khan doing these days?" To which, Zayn replied, "He's being a father, he is being himself and...he's...happy and I think when people pull back asking for space, we should give them that."

40.title: Pune City Police conferred 'Best Police Unit' in Maharashtra award
40.article_body: Pune City Police tweeted on Sunday that it's been conferred the 'Best Police Unit' in Maharashtra award. The police also shared a picture of state Home Minister Dilip Walse-Patil handing over the award. "[We'll] strive to address all issues, big and small consistently and make Pune one of the safest cities anywhere in the world with your support," police said.

41.title: Man killed in scuffle over phone theft at Pune’s Ekvira pilgrimage
41.article_body: A 49-year-old man from Thane was killed and two of his friends were injured after they got into a fight with some street performers over the suspicion of phone theft at Pune's Ekvira pilgrimage. The deceased, Manoj Patil, was struck several times with bamboo sticks and stabbed in the chest. The police have arrested two of the suspects.

42.title: Sale, use and distribution of single-use plastic banned in Gurugram from July 1
42.article_body: The manufacturing, importing, stocking, distribution and sale of single-use plastic will be banned across Gurugram with effect from July 1. According to civic body officials, violation of the rule will attract a maximum fine of ₹25,000. Seven teams, each having five officials, have been constituted to monitor and enforce penalties for single-use plastic violations, a senior official said.

43.title: Kajol remembers dad on his death anniversary, shares old pic
43.article_body: Actress Kajol on Sunday shared a post on Instagram marking the 14th death anniversary of her filmmaker-father Shomu Mukherjee. She shared an old picture with her father, and wrote, "14 years ago today you left me. I feel it till today, miss you." Kajol's sister Tanishaa also shared a post on her Instagram Stories. "Miss you dad," she wrote.

44.title: We were 14/3, but we knew we had a chance: Rahul on 3-run defeat vs RR
44.article_body: After their 3-run defeat against RR, LSG captain KL Rahul said they have a team that's never out of the contest. "Even when we are [14/3], we knew we had a chance...Games like this will give us confidence and remind us that we are a good team," he added. Chasing RR's 165-run total, LSG could score 162/8 in 20 overs.

45.title: 1 lakh square feet of B'luru's Gattahalli lake encroached: Report
45.article_body: Local activists have claimed that over one lakh square feet of the Gattahalli lake in Bengaluru has been encroached by land sharks, the Indian Express reported. Last year, the revenue department had removed some encroachments, but locals said that the lake is "repeatedly encroached". "[The lake is] under danger due to rampant illegal constructions," Citizens Movement, East Bengaluru said.

46.title: Doctors remove tooth from lungs of 6-year-old boy in Mumbai after he couldn't breathe
46.article_body: Doctors from Wockhardt Hospitals in Mumbai removed a tooth from the right lung of a six-year-old boy after he accidentally swallowed it and wasn't able to breathe or eat. ENT consultant Dr Sangamlal Pal said the patient was shifted to paediatric ICU post-operation. The boy's father said he can breathe freely now and has got a fresh lease of life.

47.title: 100 capsules containing cocaine taken out of Kenyan national's body in Mumbai
47.article_body: A 23-year-old Kenyan national was arrested for allegedly smuggling cocaine worth ₹9 crore in Mumbai. Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officials intercepted him at the international airport based on specific information and sent him for medical examination when nothing was found after they examined his baggage. At the hospital, 100 capsules containing cocaine were taken out of his body.

48.title: I felt Shahid was an arrogant man on sets of Kabir Singh: Jersey actor Geetika
48.article_body: Actress Geetika Mehandru, who worked with actor Shahid Kapoor in 'Kabir Singh' and 'Jersey' said that on the sets of 'Kabir Singh', she thought that Shahid was arrogant and moody. "But he is not. He just is in the character," she added. "Because of 'Jersey', I spent more time with him... [and] realised he's not somebody who's arrogant," Geetika said.

49.title: What does the law say about batters retiring during the innings?
49.article_body: RR's Ravichandran Ashwin became the first batter to be retired out in IPL history during their match against LSG. As per the law, a batter retires out if he retires without the umpire's permission and doesn't have the permission of the opposing captain to resume his innings. It is considered a dismissal for the purposes of calculating batting average.

50.title: Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan gets hit on stomach after 'brain fade', video goes viral
50.article_body: On the second delivery of South Africa's second innings in the second Test, Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan dropped a catch and was hit on the stomach after a "brain fade" moment. Mehidy didn't spot the ball after Sarel Erwee cut it towards the backward point. Mehidy was looking at his left and seemed to lose the ball under the lights.

51.title: Most successful people have a lot of skill and grit: Google's former CEO
51.article_body: Google's former CEO Eric Schmidt said the most successful people have a lot of skill and grit. "They're willing to put up with the setbacks and the inevitable challenges that people deal with in their...lives," the billionaire told CNBC. He added that he always wanted "a seat at the table", even if he didn't understand his ambition at the time.

52.title: RR end LSG's 3-match winning streak, jump to top of IPL 2022 points table
52.article_body: RR fast bowler Kuldeep Sen, playing in his first-ever IPL match, defended 15 runs in the last over to help his team defeat LSG by three runs. With this, RR ended LSG's three-match winning streak. RR have now jumped to the top of the IPL 2022 points table with three victories and a superior net run-rate of +0.951.

53.title: 14 unicorns created, $10.8 bn invested in startups in Q4 FY22: Report
53.article_body: As many as 14 startups attained the unicorn status in India in Q4 FY22 with the startup ecosystem attracting investment of $10.8 billion, a report by accounting firm PwC India said. With 334 funding deals in the quarter, India now has a total of 84 unicorns. With five unicorns, the software-as-a-service (SaaS) sector accounted for the largest sector-wise share.

54.title: Mexicans vote in first-ever referendum against President
54.article_body: Mexicans on Sunday began voting in a referendum on whether President Andrés Manuel López Obrador should end his term barely midway through or continue to the end. Obrador had himself pushed for the first so-called recall referendum in modern Mexico. Critics have claimed the referendum is a waste of money, which will cost the public exchequer almost $80 million.

55.title: Students clash in JNU over non-veg food, Ram Navami pooja; some injured
55.article_body: Some students in Delhi's JNU sustained injuries following a clash between members of ABVP and the Left-wing over the consumption of non-vegetarian food and the conduct of Ram Navami pooja. ABVP allegedly tried to stop non-veg from being cooked in Kaveri hostel mess. As per ABVP, however, Left-wing students tried to disrupt Ram Navami pooja. Police have been called in.

56.title: I am serious: Musk on poll to turn Twitter headquarters into homeless shelter
56.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, tweeted, "I'm serious about this", about a poll to turn Twitter headquarters in San Francisco into a homeless shelter. At the time of writing, over 91% of the respondents had voted in favour of turning the Twitter headquarters into a homeless shelter. Musk was recently named to Twitter's board.

57.title: 1,222 bodies found in Kyiv region so far: Ukrainian official
57.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova on Sunday said that 1,222 bodies have been found in the region around Kyiv so far. The areas around Ukraine's capital were recently retaken by Ukrainian forces during a retreat by Russian forces in northern Ukraine. The Ukrainian government has accused the Russian forces of committing atrocities against the civilians during their occupation.

58.title: Private taxidermy museum with over 1,000 stuffed animals found in Spain
58.article_body: Spain is investigating a businessman who owned a private taxidermy collection with more than 1,000 stuffed animals. The collection includes over 400 specimens from protected species and at least one specimen of a North African oryx, already extinct. Stuffed animals were found in two warehouses extending over 50,000 square metres on the outskirts of Spain's Bétera.

59.title: Planning permanent military presence on our eastern borders: NATO chief
59.article_body: NATO is working to set up a permanent military presence along its eastern borders in a bid to counter any future Russian threat, Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. He added that the bloc is "in the midst of a very fundamental transformation", which will reflect "long-term consequences" of Putin's actions. Stoltenberg's tenure as NATO chief has been extended till September 2023.

60.title: Capitan, you've done it again: Rana on RRR crossing ₹1,000 cr globally
60.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati, taking to Twitter, congratulated filmmaker SS Rajamouli after his film 'RRR' crossed ₹1,000 crores globally after 16 days of its release. "'ONE INDIA ONE CINEMA' was...wishful dream till one man came along and said this is what it looks like!! Capitan, you've done it again," he tweeted. Rana and Rajamouli have worked together in the 'Baahubali' franchise.

61.title: BJP doesn't have patent for Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
61.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said BJP doesn't hold the "patent for Hindutva" and that Shiv Sena has always been committed to bhagva (saffron) and Hindutva. "I wonder had Lord Ram not been born, what issue the BJP would have raised in politics. Since BJP is bereft of issues, it is talking about religion and [spreading] hatred," Thackeray said.

62.title: I had no idea, I just turned and saw him go off: Hetmyer on Ashwin retiring out
62.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin retiring out in 19th over against LSG, RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who was the other batter on the pitch at the time, said, "I literally had no idea about it." He added, "I just turned and saw him go off. He was a...bit tired. It was a good decision as Riyan Parag hit a six," Hetmyer said.

63.title: Clashes break out during Ram Navami processions in 2 Gujarat cities
63.article_body: Clashes were reported during Ram Navami processions in Himmatnagar and Khambhat in Gujarat on Sunday. Two groups pelted stones at each other, damaged shops and vehicles, following which the police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. The number of injuries recorded in both incidents is not known yet, officials said.

64.title: Would be intimidated if I'm offered film with Hrithik Roshan: Shahid
64.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said he would be intimidated if he is offered a film with actor Hrithik Roshan. "Because I...love Hrithik as an action hero and I really love him as a dancer so I would...be very nervous," Shahid stated. "I would tell him to do a bit of 'Haider' type role? Because that is my comfort zone," he added.

65.title: Was bathroom singer, thought why not take it seriously: Tiger Shroff
65.article_body: Tiger Shroff said he was a bathroom singer and added he sang well. "I thought why not take it seriously...I just wanted to start it as a hobby," he stated. "One of my goals in life was to perform on stage and sing...dance to my...songs," he added. Tiger made his singing debut in Bollywood with 'Heropanti 2' song 'Miss Hairan'.

66.title: Sri Lankan economic crisis may cause more deaths than COVID: Doctors
66.article_body: The economic crisis in Sri Lanka may lead to more deaths than those caused by COVID-19, according to Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA). All hospitals in the country no longer had access to imported medical tools and vital drugs, it claimed. "We're made to make very difficult choices. We've to decide who gets treatment and who will not," it said.

67.title: I bowl googlies more than leg-break as it turns more: RCB's Hasaranga
67.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has said that he bowls googlies more than leg-spin deliveries because his googly "turns more than" his leg-break delivery. Speaking about his team's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday, Hasaranga said, "Definitely happy with my performance, but happier with the team's win." Hasaranga scalped two wickets in the IPL 2022 match.

68.title: Video of Pak PM candidate knocking off mics during speeches goes viral
68.article_body: A video of Pakistan PM candidate Shehbaz Sharif knocking off microphones while delivering speeches has gone viral online. The video shows Sharif hitting mics with his hand gestures on several occasions while speaking at public events in Pakistan. "India mustn't take Shehbaz Sharif lightly. He's literally a mover and shaker," said one Twitter user on the video.

69.title: Don't know why I didn't get much work when I was younger: Ratna
69.article_body: Veteran actress Ratna Pathak Shah has stated that she doesn't know why she didn't get much work when she was younger, adding there was something about her that wasn't acceptable. "I was just not looked at, maybe because I was (Naseeruddin Shah's) wife and they thought I was just not interested in working. Thankfully that's done and dusted," Ratna added.

70.title: Carter and I would love to have twins: Paris Hilton
70.article_body: American socialite and businesswoman Paris Hilton has said that she would "love" to have twins with her husband Carter Reum. "I would like a twin boy and girl just to, like, get both...I would love that or twin girls because I love girls," she told the People magazine. Paris and Carter tied the knot in November last year.

71.title: Tunisians rally against Prez Saied, accuse him of 'failed dictatorship'
71.article_body: Thousands of Tunisians took to the streets in capital Tunis to protest against President Kais Saied, accusing him of imposing one-man rule in Tunisia after he dissolved parliament last month. "We are facing a failed dictatorship...We will continue to protest...until...coup is forced to reverse its decisions," a protester said. Saied also dissolved Tunisia's Supreme Judicial Council in February.

72.title: BJP gave freedom to UP's private schools to raise fees: Sisodia
72.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said BJP-led Uttar Pradesh government has given the state's private schools the freedom to increase their fees. "Within 10 days of government formation...[Punjab] CM Bhagwant Mann issued an order saying private schools cannot increase their fees," Sisodia said. Delhi's private schools have been stopped from arbitrarily increasing fees since 2015, he added.

73.title: UP vegetable sellers' daughter Mumtaz stars in junior women's hockey World Cup
73.article_body: Mumtaz Khan, the 19-year-old daughter of vegetable sellers Qaiser Jahan and Hafiz Khan from Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, helped India beat S Korea in the junior women's hockey World Cup quarterfinal on Friday. "I would've loved to watch her score the goal, but I've got to earn a living as well," her mother, who was selling vegetables during Mumtaz's match, said.

74.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history
74.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has become the first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history. Ashwin left the field in the 19th over of RR's innings against LSG after scoring 28(23). A batter is considered retired out if he retires his innings without the umpire's permission and cannot resume the innings.

75.title: Andhra CM inducts 14 new ministers into Cabinet in massive reshuffle
75.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has reconstituted his Cabinet and inducted 14 new ministers. He has retained 11 ministers, including Deputy CM K Narayanaswamy, Women and Child Welfare Minister Taneti Vanita and Social Welfare Minister Pinipe Viswarupu. The revamped Cabinet will see 68% representation from Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and Backward Classes.

76.title: Worry about your own kids: Khloé to trolls saying she holds daughter too much
76.article_body: Television personality Khloé Kardashian took to Twitter to react to trolls saying that she holds her daughter 'too much' after she carried her during the Los Angeles premiere of 'The Kardashians'. "I'm gonna hold my baby until I can't hold her anymore...When there's tons of cameras around...I want my baby to feel safe. Worry about your own children," she wrote.

77.title: You’ll get Twitter verification back, even if you shorted Tesla: Musk to investor
77.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded after American investor Michael Burry, who was portrayed in the movie 'The Big Short', said he was no longer a verified user on Twitter. "You will get it back, even though you shorted Tesla," Musk, the largest shareholder of Twitter, said. Burry ditched his bearish bets against Musk-led Tesla last year.

78.title: Russian rocket attack completely destroyed Dnipro airport: Ukraine
78.article_body: Russian forces fired rockets into Ukraine's Dnipro on Sunday, completely destroying an airport in the city, a local official said. Attacks on the city, which lies on the banks of Dnieper River, intensified on Sunday, the official added. Five staffers of the state emergency service were wounded by the strike on the airport, the head of Dnipro region council said.

79.title: Cong neither Indian nor national, only brother-sister party: Nadda
79.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said that Congress is neither Indian nor national, but only a brother-sister party. He further said, "Apart from BJP, there is no political party in the country that runs without promoting familism, many opposition parties have become regional parties only."

80.title: Important to have a second income to be choosy: Angad Hasija
80.article_body: Television actor Angad Hasija has stated that it is important to have a second income if one wants to be choosy with roles, else they would have to do whatever is offered. He is also a qualified architect and interior designer. "[My mom] wanted me to be an actor and that is how I came in this field," Angad added.

81.title: Sitaram Yechury re-elected as CPI(M) General Secretary for 3rd term
81.article_body: Sitaram Yechury was re-elected as General Secretary of CPI(M) for a third consecutive term at party's 23rd congress meet in Kerala's Kannur on Sunday. A 17-member politburo and 85-member central committee was also inducted at meet. Yechury, who was first elected to the post in 2015, had succeeded senior party leader Prakash Karat, who held the post for 10 years.

82.title: COVID-19 vaccines working against all variants: WHO chief scientist
82.article_body: COVID-19 vaccines are working against all variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus at this point in time in preventing severe disease and death, said World Health Organisation (WHO) chief scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan. "In the future, if we need to, we may have to change the composition of vaccines and we need to be prepared for that," she further said.

83.title: He's an idealist: Simi Garewal shares 2 learnings from Imran Khan's exit as Pak PM
83.article_body: Former actor and TV show host Simi Garewal on Sunday tweeted about what Imran Khan's exit as Pakistan PM taught her, saying, "1. A joint opposition can dismiss a popular Prime Minister. 2 Politics is no place for idealists." She added, "I've known Imran for 40 years and idealism is at his core."

84.title: Virat Kohli meets Baby AB after getting out to him, MI share video
84.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli met MI's Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, after getting out to him in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. Kohli was adjudged LBW out on what was Brevis' first-ever delivery in IPL. "Young man! Good one, eh! Good first meeting. [Getting] me on the first ball," Kohli was heard telling Baby AB.

85.title: Bridge over dry river bed collapses as 138-wheel lorry crosses it in MP
85.article_body: A British-era bridge in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram collapsed when a 138-wheel lorry was crossing it on the dry Sukthwa river. No injury was reported in the incident, Additional Superintendent of Police Awadhesh Pratap Singh said. After the incident, vehicular traffic was affected on the Bhopal-Nagpur highway and traffic was being diverted via Harda to Betul.

86.title: India accounts for 114 space debris, lowest in the last 4 years: NASA
86.article_body: Indian space assets account for 114 space debris, according to the latest issue of Orbital Debris Quarterly News published by NASA's Orbital Debris Program Office. India's contribution to space debris has fallen to the lowest levels in the last four years, the data showed. Earlier, NASA had said that India's anti-satellite test in 2019 had created "dangerous" space debris.

87.title: Jr NTR liked my story for 'NTR31', have been his big fan: Prashanth
87.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel, talking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said the actor liked his story. "Please don't ask me about the genre of that movie because it's far off at the moment," he stated about the film that is tentatively titled 'NTR31'. Prashanth revealed he is a "big fan" of the actor for the last 20 years.

88.title: PM Modi & Biden to hold virtual meet tomorrow to 'deepen ties'
88.article_body: US President Joe Biden will hold a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi on Monday to "further deepen ties between our governments, economies, and our people", a US official said. "Biden will continue our close consultations on...consequences of Russia's brutal war against Ukraine," the official added. The meeting will precede the India-US 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue, the official further said.

89.title: Soni Razdan asked not to discuss it: Mukesh Bhatt on Alia-Ranbir wedding
89.article_body: Alia Bhatt's uncle filmmaker Mukesh Bhatt, on being asked about her wedding with Ranbir Kapoor, has stated that he is not in a position to say anything at this time. "My sister-in-law (Soni Razdan) has asked to refrain from discussing anything about this marriage," Mukesh added. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14 in RK Studios.

90.title: BJP govt in UP has failed on all fronts: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
90.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said that the Uttar Pradesh government has failed on all fronts and the BJP is insensitive towards the problems of the youth. Yadav further said that BJP wants to rule the state by making people feel afraid, "which is highly condemnable in a democracy," adding that BJP has defamed UP.

91.title: Ram Janmbhoomi Temple's construction will be completed by Dec 2023
91.article_body: The construction of the Ram Janmbhoomi Temple in Ayodhya is in full swing and will be completed by December 2023, Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra General Secretary Champat Rai said. "Efforts are being made to install Lord Ram's idol in the sanctum sanctorum of the temple in 2023," Rai added. Construction work was interrupted earlier due to the pandemic.

92.title: 17-yr-old beaten by girl's family over suspected relationship in Guj
92.article_body: Gujarat's Panchmahal Police on Sunday arrested five people for allegedly assaulting a 17-year-old boy and two of his friends on the suspicion that he was in a relationship with a girl from the village. Police registered an FIR after a video that purportedly shows the boy and his friends being beaten with sticks surfaced online, reports said.

93.title: Cattle smuggler killed in gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri
93.article_body: A suspected cattle smuggler was killed in a gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri district, officials said on Sunday. According to police, the deceased was shot in self-defence by officials, who were chasing the vehicle the former was travelling in the previous night. Over 40 people have been killed due to police action in state since May 2021, PTI reported.

94.title: People scream from their windows after a week of total lockdown in Shanghai
94.article_body: A video reportedly showing residents in China's Shanghai screaming from their balcony windows has gone viral online. The city of 26 million residents has been under total COVID-19 lockdown for a week and people aren't allowed to leave their homes even for essential supplies. Another video showed a drone appealing to people to 'control their soul's desire for freedom'.

95.title: I have craved for this day when I'm head down in work: Raj Arjun
95.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun has stated that he has craved the day when he is head down in work since his initial days. He added the rise of OTT has turned the tide in favour of artistes who fall back on their talent and grit. "Today, I am in a position where I can ask for a bound script," Raj said.

96.title: DC defend biggest total of IPL 2022 vs KKR as Kuldeep takes 4 wickets against his ex-team
96.article_body: DC defeated KKR by 44 runs to end their two-match losing streak and move to the sixth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC put up the biggest total of IPL 2022 after scoring 215/5 in their 20 overs. DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets against his former team as KKR were dismissed for 171 in 19.4 overs.

97.title: Sunak moves out of official UK residence amid row over Akshata's taxes: Reports
97.article_body: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has moved out of his Downing Street residence in London along with his family amid a row over his wife Akshata Murty's taxes, reports said on Sunday. Removal vans were reportedly spotted outside Sunak's Downing Street flat. Reports said the family will move into their newly-renovated luxury flat in Kensington.

98.title: Pro-Russian protests in Germany amid conflict in Ukraine
98.article_body: Pro-Russian protesters gathered in Germany on Sunday to protest against discrimination in the country towards Russians following the invasion of Ukraine. The protests included a 350-car motorcade, flying Russian and also a few German flags, in Hanover city. Around 2.35 lakh Russian citizens live in Germany, according to government statistics from late 2020.

99.title: Nitish Kumar will be CM till NDA govt exists in Bihar: JD(U) leader
99.article_body: Nitish Kumar will hold the post of Chief Minister of Bihar till the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government remains in the state, Janata Dal (U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said on Sunday. He added that BJP was not pressurising Kumar to leave the post. "There is no dispute within JD(U) for the Chief Minister post in Bihar," Kushwaha said.

100.title: Have two pitches for Mahesh Babu: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli
100.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, speaking about his upcoming project with actor Mahesh Babu, has said that he has two pitches for the actor. "When 'RRR' was postponed due to Omicron variant, my father Vijayendra Prasad, ordered me not to stay idle at home. We started dabbling with a couple of ideas," Rajamouli stated. "Both of them are exciting...large-scale movies," he added.

101.title: Driver falls from road roller, dies after coming under its wheels in UP
101.article_body: The driver of a road roller died after he fell from the vehicle and came under its rear wheel in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi on Saturday. The 40-year-old man lost control over the vehicle after a high-tension electric wire fell on it. He was working on a rural road project in the Gopiganj area of Bhadohi.

102.title: Russia seeking to recruit discharged soldiers amid Ukraine war: UK
102.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry claimed on Sunday that Russia is seeking to strengthen its troop numbers in Ukraine by recruiting military personnel who were discharged from services in 2012. Russia is also trying to employ soldiers from Transnistria, a breakaway region in Moldova, the ministry further claimed. This comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern Ukraine.

103.title: UK FM Sunak considered resigning over criticism of wife's tax status: Report
103.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak considered whether he should resign after facing criticism over his wife Akshata Murty's non-domiciled tax status, The Sunday Times reported. "He was considering whether he could withstand his family taking this any more," the newspaper quoted a source as saying. Murty's non-domiciled tax status meant she didn't have to pay UK taxes on global earnings.

104.title: UK probes leak of Finance Minister Sunak's wife's tax affairs: Reports
104.article_body: The UK has reportedly launched a Whitehall inquiry into how the tax affairs of Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty were leaked to the media. Sunak was recently criticised after it was revealed that Akshata holds a non-domiciled status in the UK. Following the row, Akshata said that she will start paying UK taxes on her overseas income.

105.title: New Pak govt will not indulge in politics of revenge: Shehbaz Sharif
105.article_body: Shehbaz Sharif, who has been nominated as the next PM of Pakistan, on Sunday claimed that the new government in the country will not indulge in politics of revenge. "I don't want to go back to bitterness of...past. We want to forget them and move forward," he said. Earlier, Imran Khan had lost the no-trust vote in the National Assembly.

106.title: LSG to bowl first against RR, both teams make two changes
106.article_body: LSG won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Marcus Stoinis and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Evin Lewis and Andrew Tye, respectively. RR have also made two changes, with Rassie van der Dussen and Kuldeep Sen replacing Yashasvi Jaiswal and Navdeep Saini, respectively.

107.title: Each of 403 Assembly segments in UP to have 100-bed hospitals: Yogi
107.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday inaugurated a statewide health campaign and said that each of the 403 Assembly segments in UP will have a 100-bed hospital. "Encephalitis came under control in the past four years. The deadly encephalitis will be eradicated forever in one to two years," Yogi said while launching the Jan Arogya Mela in UP.

108.title: My wife Maanayata pushed me to do 'K.G.F: Chapter 2': Sanjay Dutt
108.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has revealed that his wife Maanayata Dutt pushed him to do the upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. The actor further said that the journey of the film has been a lesson for him after 45 years. "This film was made as a family," he added. This is Sanjay's first film since his recovery from lung cancer.

109.title: Japan & Philippines agree to enhance defence cooperation at 2+2 meeting
109.article_body: Japan and the Philippines agreed to enhance their defence cooperation at the countries' first-ever 2+2 meeting in Tokyo on Saturday. The countries affirmed their commitment to ensuring a "free and open Indo-Pacific" region, according to a statement released by Japan's Foreign Ministry. Notably, the countries have maritime disputes with China in the East and South China seas.

110.title: EV retail sales witness three-fold jump in FY22: Industry body
110.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Association (FADA) said electric vehicle (EV) retail sales in India witnessed a three-fold jump YoY from 1,34,821 units sold in FY21 to 4,29,217 units sold in FY22. "Total EV sales had stood at 1,68,300 units in FY20," it further said. Tata Motors led the segment with 15,198 units sold and a market share of 85.37%.

111.title: Wish I could tell myself at 23 not to be impulsive: Raveena
111.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has stated that when she was 23 years old, she was a grounded person but super sensitive and a bit impulsive. "I wish I could tell myself then that work in time heals everything and tell myself not to be impulsive," she added. The actress further said she had to deal with yellow journalism at the time.

112.title: 27-yr-old Pune woman harassed over extra marital affair dies by suicide
112.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Pune died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by her husband and in-laws for being involved in an extra-marital affair, police said. Investigating Officer API Manohar Sonwane said that the accused have been arrested for harassing her mentally and physically, which led the victim to take the extreme step.

113.title: AAP leader attacked with chopper by 3 minors in Pune
113.article_body: President of Aam Aadmi Party's social justice wing in Pimpri Chinchwad, Yashwant Shrimant Kamble was allegedly attacked with a chopper by three minors when he was returning home from a protest on Saturday. Kamble was returning on his two-wheeler when motorcycle-borne attackers came from behind and hit him with a sharp weapon believed to be a chopper, reports said.

114.title: UK PM travels in train to reach war-hit Ukraine; video of train surfaces
114.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson travelled on a train from Poland to Ukraine to meet the war-hit country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy recently. In a clip shared by the Ukrainian Railways online, the UK PM said, "I am travelling on a fantastic train through to Kyiv from Poland." On meeting Zelenskyy, Johnson said, "Ukrainians have shown the courage of a lion."

115.title: Chris Rock jokes about Will Smith's Oscars slap, says 'got my hearing back'
115.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock joked about actor Will Smith slapping him at the 94th Academy Awards during a recent standup show. "I'm okay...I'm not talking about [the slapping incident] until I get paid. Life is good. I got my hearing back," Chris joked. This comes after Will received a 10-year ban from attending the Oscars because of the incident.

116.title: Protest outside Sri Lankan Prez's office continues for 2nd day
116.article_body: Sri Lankan protesters continued to occupy the entrance of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office for a second day on Sunday amid a severe economic crisis in the country. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in Sri Lanka. "We will stay on, we will leave only when we have chased them out," a 32-year-old former soldier said.

117.title: Thane woman killed, 2 injured as portion of adjoining house collapses
117.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and two other persons were injured after the balcony of an adjacent house collapsed on their residence in the Thane district of Maharashtra on Sunday, officials said. The injured persons were taken to a local hospital, from where they were shifted to Mumbai for further treatment. One of the injured persons is aged 45.

118.title: Qutub Minar was built after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples: VHP
118.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad Spokesman Vinod Bansal on Sunday said Qutub Minar was built "with material obtained after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples". "Qutub Minar was actually 'Vishnu Stambh'...The superimposed structure was built just to tease the Hindu community," Bansal added. He also demanded that the 27 demolished temples be rebuilt and Hindus be allowed to offer prayers there.

119.title: 12 crude bombs used for killing pigs found in a field in Pune
119.article_body: Pune's Dighi Police recovered 12 crude bombs, used to kill pigs and stray animals, popularly known as dukkar (pig bombs), from Wadmukhwadi on Friday. According to the police, the bombs were spotted by a woman, whose five-year-old daughter was killed by the same explosives in February, when the child tried to play with it, not knowing it was a bomb.

120.title: Pics show Kapoors' bungalow being lit up ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
120.article_body: Pictures have shown lights being put up at a bungalow belonging to actor Ranbir Kapoor's family, ahead of his rumoured wedding with Alia Bhatt on April 17. Visuals showed Krishna Raj Bungalow being lit up, even as reports said that some wedding rituals will be performed there. The couple will reportedly move into the bungalow after their wedding.

121.title: NCB busts illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata, arrests 4 people
121.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted an illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata and arrested four people on Friday. NCB raided a godown of accused, identified as Minagur Rahaman, who is allegedly involved in retail sale of psychotropic substances, and recovered injections, cough syrups and capsules. One of the seized drugs is used to treat addiction to opioids, NCB added.

122.title: Delhi govt’s parent outreach programme yet to cover 250 schools
122.article_body: A report on the Delhi government's parent outreach programme launched last year found that it is yet to cover 250 schools. A report submitted by the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights said that out of the 1,068 government schools, School Management Committee (SMC) members and school mitras had done no interactions with parents in 250 schools.

123.title: K'taka govt hands over probe into B'luru road rage killing to CID
123.article_body: The Karnataka government has handed over the probe into the road rage incident, in which a 22-year-old man was killed in Bengaluru to CID, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. "I have instructed higher officials of the police department. Our officials have collected evidence," he added. The victim was stabbed to death by three men in JJ Nagar on Tuesday.

124.title: Sony TV's Kaun Banega Crorepati registrations are now open
124.article_body: Sony Entertainment Television has opened online registrations for the upcoming fourteenth season of Kaun Banega Crorepati. Starting April 9, host Mr. Amitabh Bachchan will ask a new question everyday at 9pm, giving aspirants a chance to be India's next crorepati with the power of their knowledge, Sony Entertainment Television announced.

125.title: Delhi Capitals record highest total of IPL 2022
125.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) put up a total of 215/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Sunday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far and their fourth highest total in IPL history. It is the eighth time that DC have scored more than 200 runs in an innings in IPL. DC slammed 11 sixes in their innings today.

126.title: Coinbase suspends UPI payments option in India days after launch
126.article_body: US-based crypto exchange Coinbase has disabled the option to buy cryptocurrencies using UPI method in India. The development comes days after Coinbase launched its trading services in India and said it would allow users to buy crypto using UPI. After the launch, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) had clarified it wasn't aware of any crypto exchange using UPI.

127.title: India's 5th richest man Damani reduces Blue Dart stake, hikes stake in VST: Report
127.article_body: Radhakishan Damani, DMart owner and India's fifth-richest person with a net worth of $20 billion according to Forbes, has increased his shareholding in Hyderabad-based cigarettes company VST Industries, The Economic Times reported. He bought 12,000 equity shares of VST Industries during the January-March period. He decreased in logistics company Blue Dart Express in the March 2022 quarter.

128.title: Russian helicopters destroy Ukrainian military convoy: Report
128.article_body: A convoy of Ukrainian military vehicles was destroyed by Russian attack helicopters, a news agency reported on Sunday, citing Russia's Defence Ministry. Videos published by the ministry showed helicopters flying at low altitude, launching missiles and firing from guns at ground targets. However, the location and the timing of the attack was not specified.

129.title: NC will welcome those who want to strengthen pluralistic J&K: Farooq
129.article_body: National Conference (NC) chief Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday that party will welcome those who want to strengthen the idea of a united, democratic and pluralistic Jammu and Kashmir. Abdullah added that NC's vision is to protect the social, cultural and political interests of people from all regions and religions. He made the remarks at a party event in Jammu.

130.title: Revamped bus stop inaugurated in Mumbai; 105 more to come up soon
130.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday inaugurated the revamped bus stop of Famous Studio in Mumbai's Worli and promised such "sleek bus stops in another 105 locations" across Mumbai. He also inaugurated the revamped Shri Shantinath Chowk and Late Smt Sunita Dattaji Nalawade Manoranjan Maidan. These projects are part of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's Tactical Urbanism Initiative.

131.title: Did 1 scene with Rishi Kapoor, wasn't starstruck but excited: Isha
131.article_body: Actress Isha Talwar has stated that she did one scene with late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor in the film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "I was there when he was shooting his other scenes and I was doing something else on those days," she added. Isha further said that she grew up watching him act and dance and she wasn't starstruck but excited.

132.title: Freedom struggle begins again: Imran Khan after being removed as Pak PM
132.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday made his first remarks after losing a no-confidence motion against him in the country's Parliament. "Pakistan became an independent state in 1947, but the freedom struggle begins again today against a foreign conspiracy of regime change," tweeted Khan. "It's always the people of the country who defend their sovereignty and democracy," he added.

133.title: Have chances to win championship: Ferrari's Leclerc after Aus GP win
133.article_body: After winning the 2022 F1 Australian Grand Prix, Ferrari's driver Charles Leclerc has said that his team "have chances" to win the championship. "Obviously, we're only at the third race so it's difficult to think about the championship, but...we've got a very strong car," he stated. The last time Ferrari won the championship was back in 2007 with Kimi Räikkönen.

134.title: Very good player for future: Plessis after Anuj Rawat's 66(47) vs MI
134.article_body: RCB skipper Faf du Plessis has praised opener Anuj Rawat after his 47-ball 66 in RCB's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. "Anuj has potential...Comes down the wicket, shows intent, he's a very good player for the future," Du Plessis stated. In the ongoing tournament, the 22-year-old has scored 113 runs in four innings so far.

135.title: Dulquer's next film with Mrunal, Rashmika titled 'Sita Ramam'
135.article_body: Director Hanu Raghavapudi and his production team announced the title of their next film on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The film, titled 'Sita Ramam', stars Dulquer Salmaan, Rashmika Mandanna and Mrunal Thakur. The makers also shared a glimpse of the upcoming project, which revolves around the characters of Dulquer and Mrunal, who play Ram and Sita, respectively.

136.title: MI came back from behind to win IPL 2015, but that team was different: Irfan
136.article_body: Following Mumbai Indians' four consecutive defeats in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan recalled MI's IPL 2015 campaign where the team lost their first four matches, but still managed to lift the trophy. "In IPL 2015, they were in...similar situation...but that team was a little different," Irfan stated. Mumbai are yet to win a match in the ongoing tournament.

137.title: Fielding is where game vs KKR will be won or lost: DC's David Warner
137.article_body: David Warner said Delhi Capitals will be looking to "outfield" Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL 2022 match on Sunday. "Fielding is...big component...that's where...game will be won or lost," Warner stated. DC have won one out of their three matches in the tournament so far. "We can't afford to get too far behind in terms of wins," he added.

138.title: FPIs invest ₹7,707 cr in April after 6-month-long selling streak
138.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net buyers between April 1-8 and invested ₹7,707 crore in Indian equities after a six-month-long selling streak. FPIs put in ₹1,403 crore in the debt markets in the period under review after pulling out net ₹8,705 crore in February and March 2022. Between October 2021 and March 2022, FPIs withdrew net ₹1.48 lakh crore.

139.title: We're like Lagaan team, intention was to win: Yash on KGF's success
139.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actor Yash, speaking about the film series' success, has said that they are like the team in 2001 film 'Lagaan' as their intention was to come and win. He added that they didn't have many resources but pushed his director's work. "I had to convince him to take KGF to India and...we went full out," Yash said.

140.title: Several people join Ram Navami procession in B'luru; video surfaces
140.article_body: Several people joined the Ram Navami procession which was taken out in the Padmanabhanagar area of Bengaluru on Sunday. A video shows people chanting slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram' while taking part in the procession. BJP MP from Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya and Karnataka Minister R Ashoka also joined the procession.

141.title: 2 terrorists linked to attack on CRPF troops, shot dead in Srinagar
141.article_body: Two terrorists, linked to a recent attack on the CRPF troops, were shot dead in Srinagar on Sunday, tweeted the Kashmir Zone Police. "They belonged to Pakistan and were from Lashkar-e-Taiba. Both were gunned down. Our personnel have become a soft target for terrorists. Militancy is declining and we'll ensure it dwindles further," said IGP (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar.

142.title: NGT forms panel to probe encroachment of wetlands in GB Nagar
142.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the setting up of a joint committee of UP officials to file a report on alleged encroachment of 117 water bodies and wetlands in Gautam Buddha Nagar. The committee has been asked to submit the report in two months. The committee has been also asked to mention the measures taken for their protection.

143.title: American skater Alysa Liu retires aged 16, says 'It has been an insane 11 years'
143.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist figure skater Alysa Liu of the US has announced her retirement aged 16. "I started skating when I was five so that's about 11 years on the ice and it's been an insane 11 years," she wrote on Instagram. "I feel so satisfied with how my skating career has gone," the two-time US national champion added.

144.title: Janhvi Kapoor, Varun Dhawan's 'Bawaal' goes on floors in Lucknow
144.article_body: The shooting of Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Bawaal' has begun on Sunday. Director Nitesh Tiwari's wife Ashwiny Iyer took to her Instagram handle to announce the commencement of the shoot. Reportedly, In India, the filming is scheduled to happen in three different locations. Apart from India, the shooting of 'Bawaal' will take place in four European places including Paris.

145.title: BJP to fight Himachal elections under CM Thakur's leadership: Nadda
145.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda has said that the party will contest this year's Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections under CM Jai Ram Thakur's leadership. "He (Thakur) will not be replaced and the BJP will contest the Assembly elections under his leadership," Nadda said. "10-15% BJP MLAs did not get tickets in UP...and it is likely to happen here too," he added.

146.title: Gotabaya govt to blame for Sri Lanka's economic crisis: Ex-PM
146.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sunday accused incumbent administration of being responsible for Sri Lanka's economic crisis due to its "incompetence", adding that people want President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to resign. "When I left the office in 2019, we had a surplus budget," he added. Sri Lanka is experiencing a shortage of essential items, including food supplies, medicines and fuel.

147.title: 'Star Trek', 'As The World Turns' actress Kathryn Hays passes away at 87
147.article_body: Veteran American actress Kathryn Hays, known for her pivotal roles in 'Star Trek' and 'As The World Turns', has passed away at the age of 87. According to Deadline, she died on March 25 in Fairfield, Connecticut. Kathryn Hays is survived by her daughter and son-in-law, three grandchildren, and a great-grandson, as per Deadline.

148.title: Is that a punishment: Colin Jost on Will Smith's 10 year Oscar ban
148.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for 10 years, Colin Jost joked about The Academy's decision stating that the ban wasn't the best way to punish him. He said, "Is that a punishment? He can still be nominated...He just doesn't have to attend the four-hour ceremony where someone is...going to make fun of his wife again."

149.title: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc wins Australian Grand Prix
149.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claimed his second win in the ongoing Formula One season by winning the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. The Monaco-born racer secured his fourth career win by more than 20 seconds ahead of the runner-up Sergio Perez. Red Bull's Max Verstappen had to retire mid-way after his car started having some technical problems.

150.title: Elon Musk is now $100 billion richer than Jeff Bezos: Forbes
150.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now nearly $100 billion richer than Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List. Musk's net worth is now pegged at $282 billion while Bezos' net worth is at $183.6 billion. Musk, who started with a net worth of $26.6 billion in 2020, saw his wealth soar during the COVID-19 pandemic.

151.title: Strange cloud formation appears over mountain in US, locals share pics
151.article_body: Locals in US' Alaska shared pictures of a strange cloud-like formation that appeared above the Lazy Mountain, prompting a police investigation into its origin. After theories suspecting a UFO crash or a Russian weapon surfaced online, the Alaska State Troopers issued a statement, saying, "A contrail from a commercial jet combined with the rising sun...caused the unique atmospheric sight."

152.title: I've never yelled like that in my life: Shastri recalls scolding MSD for playing football
152.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri recalled scolding MS Dhoni for playing football ahead of an Asia Cup final match. "There was dew...he went skidding five minutes before the toss. I've never yelled like that in my life. I said, 'Stop the game!'" Shastri said. "He loves it...The intensity with which he plays football scares you from the outside," he stated.

153.title: 'Everyone loves Deepika' dialogue wasn't improvised; it was in script: Abhishek
153.article_body: On 'The Kapil Sharma Show', comedian-host Kapil Sharma asked Abhishek Bachchan about the dialogue 'Everyone loves Deepika' and questioned, "Was this dialogue a part of...[Dasvi] script or did you improvise it?" To which Abhishek replied, "No, no, it was there in the script. Otherwise, I would've taken the name of someone else. After all, I've to go back home."

154.title: Why administer booster dose only through pvt hospitals: Congress
154.article_body: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for not allowing government hospitals to administer COVID-19 vaccine booster dose. "Why administer this booster dose only through private hospitals and have no option of getting it through government hospitals. Does it make sense?," asked Singhvi. He further accused this policy of being "discriminatory" towards poor people.

155.title: Entire European project is Russia's target: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
155.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that Russia's aggression is not limited to Ukraine but that the "entire European project" is Russia's target. He added that this is why everyone must support Ukraine as it's "a strategy of defence for every civilized state". Russia's use of force is "a catastrophe that will inevitably hit everyone", he further said.

156.title: Pune's atheist meet may disturb law & order on Ram Navami; postponed
156.article_body: An atheist conference scheduled in Pune on Sunday has been postponed, as the city police feared that "organising the event on the day of Ram Navami festival could cause law and order problems," organisers said. An organiser, Dr Nitin Hande said, "The police also said some Hindutvawadi outfits have taken objection to the event."

157.title: Ayesha Takia's husband alleges racism at Goa airport, says 'officer tried to touch wife'
157.article_body: Actress Ayesha Takia Azmi's husband Abu Farhan Azmi alleged CISF officers of racism after calling his name "out loud" at Goa airport. "Altercation started when an armed male officer...tried to physically touch & tell my wife, son to stand in another line," he tweeted. He also alleged that a guard "made a dirty sexual comment" while checking his pockets.

158.title: Not scared of any ban: Cong leader who questioned Irani on petrol prices in flight
158.article_body: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress who questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing petrol and LPG prices, tweeted, "Not scared of any ban. I'll keep showing Mirror of Truth to Modi Govt & its Ministers!" D'Souza was responding to a Twitter user who said she could be handed a six-month flight ban.

159.title: Need to close situations: Zaheer Khan after MI's loss against RCB
159.article_body: After Mumbai Indians suffered their fourth straight loss in IPL 2022, team director Zaheer Khan said that the franchise needs to close situations when the momentum begins to shift away. "You’ve got to be able to close those moments of the game...We’ve...not been able to do that... It’s a long season, need to keep things tight," Zaheer said.

160.title: Deepika shares poem she wrote in class 7, says it was her 'first & last' attempt
160.article_body: Deepika Padukone took to Instagram on Sunday to share a poem that she wrote in her childhood. The actress mentioned that it was her "first and [the] last attempt at writing poetry". "This was in grade 7. I was 12. The poem was titled 'I Am'. We were given...first 2 words that you see...and the rest is history," Deepika wrote.

161.title: Happy to have Faf as opening partner: RCB batter Anuj Rawat
161.article_body: RCB opener Anuj Rawat has said that he is "really happy" that captain Faf Du Plessis is his opening partner. "It feels great to be a part of RCB. Opening with Faf and having players like Virat...it’s a great feeling for me," Rawat said. "Finally...I was having the same mindset as (that of) previous games," he added.

162.title: Ayush Badoni has all qualities of a future star: Harbhajan
162.article_body: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said that he believes the Lucknow Super Giants' 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni has the qualities of becoming a "future star". "Badoni is a very confident player...(don't) get the feeling that this is his debut season. He has this quality to absorb pressure which is a sign of...a future star," Harbhajan said.

163.title: Plea in Pak court to stop ex-PM Imran Khan from leaving country
163.article_body: The Islamabad High Court will hear a plea seeking to prevent former PM Imran Khan and some ministers of the erstwhile government from leaving the country, according to reports. The petition demands Khan, former ministers Shah Mahmood Qureshi and Fawad Chaudhry to be put on the exit control list. This comes after Khan lost no-confidence motion in the National Assembly.

164.title: Bryan, Aaron to reprise 'Breaking Bad' roles in 'Better Call Saul' final season
164.article_body: 'Breaking Bad' actors Bryan Cranston and Aaron Paul are set to return as Walter White and Jesse Pinkman in the final season of spin-off series 'Better Call Saul'. Confirming the news, the show's Twitter account shared a picture of Bryan and Aaron with a message that read, "They're coming back." Bob Odenkirk plays the lead role in 'Better Call Saul'.

165.title: Woman charged with murder in US' Texas for abortion; protest held
165.article_body: A protest was held outside a sheriff's office in US' Texas over a 26-year-old woman being allegedly charged with murder after authorities said she had caused the "the death of an individual by self-induced abortion". In Texas, abortions are banned as early as six weeks. Lizelle Herrera was arrested on Thursday with a bond set at $500,000 (nearly ₹3.8 crore).

166.title: Deeply disappointed in Putin, he seemed to be man of peace: Ex-Italy PM
166.article_body: Ex-Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi has said that he's deeply disappointed in Russian President Vladimir Putin amid ongoing Ukraine war, adding that Putin had seemed to be "man of democracy and peace” to him. "The...Ukraine [war], instead of bringing Russia into Europe has thrown it into...arms of China," Berlusconi added. Berlusconi had termed Putin "number one among world leaders" in 2015.

167.title: COVID-19 is a 'bahurupiya' disease, never know when it'll resurface: PM Modi
167.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday urged people not to let their guards down in the battle against COVID-19 and called it a 'bahurupiya' (form-changing) disease. "Coronavirus was a big crisis and we aren't saying that [it's] over," PM said at a virtual event. He added, "It may have taken a pause, but we never know when it will resurface."

168.title: Dylan wishes fiancée Kristen on b'day, says 'Time looks good on you'
168.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart celebrated her 32nd birthday with her fiancée Dylan Meyer. Taking to Instagram, Dylan shared a post with Kristen with a picture where they are seen leaning in for a kiss over a birthday cake. She captioned the post, "Another one around the sun and you're out here getting flyer every year. Time looks good on you."

169.title: Important to fight together as BJP trying to weaken Opp'n: Kharge
169.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said the Opposition must "fight together...[as BJP-RSS] are trying to see to it that only one party remains". Reacting to BSP chief Mayawati's comments that Congress should worry about itself, Kharge said, "Congress has always been with people." He asserted that Congress had indeed invited Mayawati to lead the anti-BJP alliance in Uttar Pradesh.

170.title: Brie Larson joins 'Fast & Furious 10', Vin says 'Welcome to the family'
170.article_body: Brie Larson, who plays Captain Marvel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has joined the cast of 'Fast & Furious 10'. Actor Vin Diesel took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news. "You have no idea how timeless and amazing she will be in our mythology...Welcome to the FAMILY Brie," he wrote. The upcoming instalment will also feature Jason Momoa.

171.title: Ghaziabad completes 100% 1st dose vaccination for those aged 15-18
171.article_body: Ghaziabad district has completed administering the first dose of COVID-19 vaccination to 100% of those in 15-18 age group. "There were delays in completing...first dose target as many children didn't turn up," a senior official said. "We've to keep in mind that their annual school examinations are nearing and that is why there was a little delay," the official added.

172.title: Rajasthan man shoots woman dead for refusing to marry him; later kills self
172.article_body: A 30-year-old killed himself after shooting a woman dead as she had refused to marry him in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Both the deceased knew each other for the last five years. As per preliminary investigation, the man, who was married and had two children, wanted to marry the woman and also suspected her of having an affair with another man.

173.title: Fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi, no casualty reported
173.article_body: A fire broke out at a banquet hall near the Peeragarhi Chowk in Delhi on Sunday morning, officials said. They added that no casualty was reported in the incident. The fire services department received a call about the incident at 11 am and seven fire-tenders were sent to the spot, Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said.

174.title: Noida Authority successfully carries out test blast at Supertech twin towers
174.article_body: A test blast to demolish the illegally-built Supertech twin towers in Noida was successfully carried out around 2.30 pm on Sunday. Edifice Engineering and Jet Demolition were roped in by Noida Authority for this purpose. The test blast was carried out to ascertain the amount of explosives needed for the towers' actual demolition, which will take place on May 22.

175.title: Smugglers throw cows from truck during high-speed police chase in Gurugram
175.article_body: A video has surfaced of a high-speed police chase of cattle smugglers, in which cows are seen being thrown out of their truck by the smugglers. The 22-km-long chase took place in Gurugram's Cyber City area early on Saturday and the accused reportedly drove the truck with deflated tires. Five people were arrested at the end of the chase.

176.title: There's some extra love in the air: Ayan on Alia & Ranbir's Brahmāstra poster
176.article_body: Amid Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding reports, the couple's close friend and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji dropped a new poster of Brahmāstra. Sharing the poster featuring Alia and Ranbir together, Ayan wrote, "Brahmāstra is about the Energy of Love.
