A love, that spreads like fire...The time feels right for it...There is some extra love in the air these days!"

177.title: Delhi Police arrests 76, recover 1.4 kg of ganja in last 24 hrs
177.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 76 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 1.425 kilograms of ganja in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 17 proclaimed offenders, seized 979 quarters of illicit liquor and recovered 11 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,829 calls, the post added.

178.title: First round of presidential elections underway in France
178.article_body: Voting for the first round of presidential elections started on Sunday. Around 4.8 crore citizens are eligible to vote in the contest between 12 candidates, including the incumbent President Emmanuel Macron and prominent leaders like Marine Le Pen and Jean-Luc Melenchon. If no candidate manages to get over 50% votes, a second round will be held between the top two.

179.title: 9-year-old girl writes letter to mother killed in Ukraine, says 'I'll never forget you'
179.article_body: A nine-year-old girl has written a letter to her mother who was killed in Russia's war in Ukraine, saying "I'll never forget you." She added, "I'll do my best to be a good person and get in heaven too. See you in heaven!" The letter was shared by Anton Gerashchenko, an adviser to the Minister of Internal Affairs of Ukraine.

180.title: Congress leader questions Smriti Irani on rising petrol, LPG prices in flight
180.article_body: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress, questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing prices of petrol and LPG. Irani initially said that D'Souza was "blocking the way", and when the minister was asked about "stoves without gas", she said, "please don't lie". Recently, petrol prices were hiked 14 times in 16 days.

181.title: I wish somebody was there to guide me: Taha Shah Badussha
181.article_body: Actor Taha Shah Badussha, who made his debut in 2011 film 'Luv Ka The End', has said that he joined the industry when he was 20 but wishes he could when he was 14. "Looking back, I believe everything that happened was to make me stronger. I also wish somebody was there to guide me," the actor added.

182.title: Hyderabad man posts morphed photos of woman online, arrested
182.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police have arrested a man for allegedly harassing a woman by posting morphed photos of her across social media platforms. The 28-year-old accused, who took screenshots from video calls between him and the woman, posted photos after victim refused to engage in further conversations with him. According to police, accused also sent the same photos to victim's husband.

183.title: No FBI team is in India to probe Karnataka Bitcoin scam case: CBI
183.article_body: The CBI said the US' Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has not sent any team to India to conduct a probe into an alleged Bitcoin scam case that is being investigated by Karnataka Police. Several Congress leaders earlier claimed the FBI is in India to investigate the Bitcoin scam, which the party alleged the Karnataka BJP government had covered up.

184.title: New Delhi civic body starts 'Suvidha Camp' for grievance redressal
184.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) on Saturday began a two-week 'Suvidha Camp' at its Convention Centre on Jai Singh Road. The NDMC received 114 grievances on the first day of the camp, according to officials. "All grievances were discussed face-to-face between the public and the concerned officials of the NDMC departments for expeditious resolutions," an official said.

185.title: Don't try to break homes: Prakash Raj on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
185.article_body: Actor-politician Prakash Raj on Friday tweeted, "Don't try to break homes, Mr Home Minister. We dare you #stopHindiImposition. We love our diversity, we love our mother tongue, we love our identities." His tweet comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.

186.title: SP not working for Muslims, alleges party's Lok Sabha MP Barq
186.article_body: Samajwadi Party MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq has accused his own party of not "working for Muslims". "I am not satisfied with the working, the entire Samajwadi is not working for Muslims," the Lok Sabha MP said after he voted for the UP Legislative Council elections on Saturday. He also accused the Yogi Adityanath-led government of not "doing justice with Muslims".

187.title: Table-toppers KKR to bowl first against seventh-placed DC, playing XIs announced
187.article_body: Table-toppers KKR won the toss and elected to bowl first against seventh-placed DC in their IPL 2022 clash in Mumbai on Sunday. KKR, who have won two matches in a row, are playing with an unchanged side. DC, who have lost two matches in a row, have made one change to their playing XI, with Khaleel Ahmed replacing Anrich Nortje.

188.title: U'khand CM performs 'kanya poojan' at Dehradun house; pics surface
188.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday performed 'kanya poojan' at his residence in Dehradun on the occasion of Ram Navami. He also shared pictures of the event, saying, "I pray that the blessings of Maa Durga always remain on all of us." On Ram Navami, the ninth day of Chaitra Navaratri, nine girls representing Goddess Durga's avatars are worshipped.

189.title: KKR's ₹8-cr buy Nitish Rana needs to show more responsibility: Aakash
189.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that KKR batter Nitish Rana needs to show "more responsibility" in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Nitish has been purchased for ₹8 crore...He is not doing the job yet," Aakash stated. The 28-year-old, who was KKR's third-highest run-scorer in IPL 2021, has scored 39 runs in four innings in IPL 2022 so far, averaging 9.75.

190.title: Language chauvinism will boomerang: KTR on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
190.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remark that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English. Rao said, "Language chauvinism/hegemony will boomerang." He asked, "Why don't we let people of our great nation decide what to eat, what to wear, who to pray to...what language to speak!"

191.title: Hyd Police bust IPL betting racket, seize materials worth ₹1.20 crore
191.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday arrested five persons from the city's Vanasthalipuram area for being allegedly involved in an IPL betting racket. Police also seized cash and other items worth ₹1.20 crore from accused's possession. One of the accused had opened two current bank accounts in the name of two trading entities to run racket and mislead authorities, police said.

192.title: Woman shares pics of 14-yr-old son's bruised hand, smashed phone after Ronaldo's outburst
192.article_body: After Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo smashed the phone out of a boy's hand in frustration after 0-1 loss against Everton, the mother of the boy shared pictures of his bruised hand and smashed phone. The woman revealed that her 14-year-old son was in complete shock and couldn't digest what happened as he is autistic and has got dyspraxia.

193.title: Police constable harasses woman officer over WhatsApp in Mumbai; booked
193.article_body: A police constable has been booked for allegedly harassing a woman police officer over WhatsApp and stalking her in Mumbai. The Khar Police said a case has been registered against him under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the IT Act. The constable has not been arrested yet, the Khar Police added.

194.title: We need 1% increase of rates: Kotak as RBI raises inflation forecast to 5.7%
194.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak questioned the RBI's decision to raise retail inflation projection and keep repo rates unchanged. "RBI policy: Sharp increase in inflation estimate to 5.7%...Present repo rate at 4%," Kotak tweeted. "If India has to move to 0% real rate that is, inflation - interest rate = 0, we need 1% increase of rates," he added.

195.title: BharatPe has put the Ashneer row behind & posted record growth: CEO
195.article_body: BharatPe posted record growth in FY22, is on track to break even and list on stock exchanges in the next 18-24 months after putting behind the controversy around Co-founder Ashneer Grover, CEO Suhail Sameer said. He added that his priority is BharatPe's employees so that they stay focused. "Business in Q4 FY22 is up 20% on every metric," Sameer said.

196.title: How did a gang steal a 60-feet bridge in Bihar?
196.article_body: A gang dismantled a 60-feet iron bridge in Bihar and likely sold it in parts as scrap metal. The robbers, posing as government officials with the irrigation department, "came with heavy machinery, gas cutters and worked for two days during daytime to dismantle the bridge," Reuters quoted a villager. The bridge was built over a water canal three decades ago.

197.title: Had an affair with a director; even got pregnant: Lock Upp contestant Mandana
197.article_body:
'Lock Upp' contestant Mandana Karimi spoke about the time she was going through a separation from her husband and revealed that she had a secret affair with a filmmaker at that point. "My relationship was with a...director who talks about women's rights," she said. "We 
 planned...pregnancy," Mandana revealed in the promo, which ended with shots of those around her crying.

198.title: 'Adipurush' director shares fan-made posters showing Prabhas' look as Lord Ram
198.article_body: On the occasion of Ram Navami, 'Adipurush' director Om Raut took to Twitter and shared some fan-made posters showing Prabhas' look as Lord Ram. "Celebrating the victory of good over evil #ramnavami," he wrote. The film, an adaptation of 'Ramayana', will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram and Saif Ali Khan as Lankesh. It also stars Kriti Sanon and Sunny Singh.

199.title: Supriya Sule to inaugurate Symbiosis elderly care centre in Pune on Apr 12
199.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MP Supriya Sule will inaugurate the Symbiosis Centre for Geriatric Care in Pune on April 12. Several senior citizen clubs, 'Hasya Yoga' groups and those running old-age homes will be felicitated at the event. A senior doctor said that all the services will be provided within a well-confined area to ensure accessibility at the centre.

200.title: BMC to install rooftop solar panels on toilet blocks in Goregaon
200.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install rooftop solar panels on street toilet blocks in Mumbai's Goregaon area. A BMC official said that the initiative is being carried out to utilise space and clean energy. "The rooftops of toilet blocks have little use...Most land ends up becoming storage space or has no use at all," the official said.

201.title: Palestinians set fire to West Bank shrine: Israeli military
201.article_body: The Israeli military on Sunday claimed that about 100 Palestinians marched towards a West Bank shrine and set it on fire. This comes amid the escalating tension between Israel and Palestine during the holy month of Ramzan. "The vandalism of Joseph's Tomb is a grave event and a serious violation of freedom of worship," said Israel's Defence Minister.

202.title: MNS plays 'Hanuman Chalisa' outside Shiv Sena’s Mumbai office; 2 detained
202.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) played 'Hanuman Chalisa' on a loudspeaker outside Shiv Sena's headquarter in Mumbai on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The Mumbai Police stopped the 'Hanuman Chalisa' and detained MNS leader Yashwant Killedar and a taxi driver. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray called for the removal of loudspeakers from mosques.

203.title: Distributing freebies policy decision of parties, can't intervene: EC tells SC
203.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) informed the Supreme Court that distributing freebies is a policy decision of a political party and that it doesn't have the power to intervene. "Whether such decisions are financially viable or have an adverse effect, has to be decided by voters," the EC added. Such an action would be an overreach of its powers, it claimed.

204.title: Shehbaz Sharif nominated as new Pakistan PM by country's Opposition
204.article_body: The Leader of Opposition in the National Assembly of Pakistan, Shehbaz Sharif, has been nominated as the next PM of the country after Imran Khan was dismissed as Pakistan's PM on Sunday. Sharif is the president of the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) party. Khan became the first Pakistani PM to lose the no-trust vote in Parliament.

205.title: Italian Embassy counsellor robbed off her handbag in Delhi; 2 arrested
205.article_body: A 54-year-old counsellor working at the Italian Embassy was robbed of her handbag by unidentified persons at Delhi's Barapullah flyover. The victim was heading home in an auto from her office when one of the accused robbed her of her handbag containing her phone, ID cards, debit cards and gold jewellery. Police have arrested two persons in this connection.

206.title: 26-year-old man arrested for invading pitch and giving fist bumps to Kohli, Rohit
206.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested by Pune Police for invading the pitch during MI-RCB match on Saturday. He was booked by police on charges of trespassing and creating ruckus as he was seen giving fist bumps to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma before being escorted out. A police official said that the fan also manhandled the policemen on duty.

207.title: Traffic to be suspended for 30 mins for test blast at Noida twin towers today
207.article_body: Traffic movement will be suspended for 30 minutes, from 2.15-2.45 pm on Sunday, around Supertech's twin towers in Noida, where a test blast would be carried out around 2.30 pm. The area will be cordoned off by police. "Traffic movement will be restricted from ATS junction to Gejha Phool Mandi and from Eldeco Chowk to Sector 108," an inspector said.

208.title: Reports claim Imran Khan tried to remove Pakistan Army chief, he denies
208.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan tried to dismiss Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa but a notification was not issued by the Defence Ministry, reports said. However, according to Geo News, Khan told journalists, "There was neither any talk of dismissing the Army chief nor was this on the cards." Khan lost the no-confidence vote and was removed as Pakistan's PM.

209.title: The Kashmir Files is the real game changer, not RRR: Ram Gopal Varma
209.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma believes the success of 'The Kashmir Files' is "the real game changer" being made on a small budget of ₹10 crore. "RRR isn't a game-changer and...I don't think it can bring about a change. It's a film that's produced on a lavish scale." "Whereas, if you consider 'The Kashmir Files'...It gives filmmakers... much-needed confidence," he said.

210.title: 2 minor boys drown in lake while swimming with friends in Thane
210.article_body: Two boys, aged 11 and 12 years, drowned while swimming in a lake in Thane, police said on Sunday. The incident took place when six boys from Dhamankar Naka entered the Varaladevi lake for a swim. While four of the boys came out of the lake after swimming, they informed police as they were unable to locate the two others.

211.title: Pune locals protest as BJP corporator renames garden after father
211.article_body: Residents of Pune's Salisbury Park have been protesting for the past three weeks after BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale renamed a PMC garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale, and put up a board with the name on it. A resident forum's chairman said that while they acknowledged Bhimale's efforts for the garden, its renaming seemed like "an attempt to hog..limelight".

212.title: Alia respects everyone a lot, she's not jealous of anyone: Neetu
212.article_body: Neetu Kapoor said in an interview that actress Alia Bhatt is a very sweet and nice girl. She added that the 29-year-old actress respects everyone a lot and is not jealous of anyone. "Ranbir too is a kind-hearted guy. They both make a great pair," Neetu further said. The couple will reportedly get married in an intimate ceremony this week.

213.title: Anupam shares pic with Big B, Neena; fan says 'History of cinema in 1 pic'
213.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, shared a selfie with the cast of his upcoming film, 'Uunchai'. The picture featured Amitabh Bachchan, Boman Irani, Neena Gupta and Sarika. "May your day feel as good as taking a perfect selfie of perfect happy moments," Anupam wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "History of cinema in this one picture is remarkable."

214.title: Cong should worry about itself: Mayawati on Rahul's UP alliance offer comment
214.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BSP chief Mayawati didn't respond to the party's alliance offer in Uttar Pradesh during elections, Mayawati said the Congress needs to worry about itself first. "The Congress must think 100 times before making such comments. They've been unable to win against the BJP, but they just keep taking these potshots," she added.

215.title: Ukraine says 12 soldiers returning after prisoner swap with Russia
215.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Prime Minister Iryna Vereshchuk said that 12 of the country's soldiers are coming home following a prisoner exchange with Russia on Saturday. Apart from soldiers, Vereshchuk said that 14 civilians were also returning to Ukraine as part of the deal. This was the third such prisoner swap since the war began, she added.

216.title: Mumbai's Mithi river polluted for last 11 years: MPCB report
216.article_body: A report published by the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) has revealed that Mumbai's Mithi river has remained 'polluted to heavily polluted' for the past 11 years. The 17.8 km long river was found once (2012-13) in the non-polluted category in the past 11 years. The water quality index (WQI) of the river was 44 in 2020-21, the report said.

217.title: Amrinder Singh Brar appointed as Congress’ Punjab chief
217.article_body: Three-time MLA Amrinder Singh Brar, also known as Raja Warring, was appointed as the Congress' new Punjab chief by party President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. Warring served as the Transport Minister in the previous state government. Meanwhile, Pratap Singh Bajwa was appointed as the leader of legislature party, while Raj Kumar as its deputy leader.

218.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui confirms on 'Lock Upp' he is married and has a son
218.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, during an episode of 'Lock Upp', confirmed he is married and has a son. "I'm not hiding anything, but we've been separate for the past one-and-a-half years. The matter is in court and I don't want to discuss that. It has been difficult," Munawar said. He later suggested that he is doing the show for his son.

219.title: BJP MP shares video of 92-yr-old man completing 5 km-run in B'luru
219.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Sunday shared a video of a 92-year-old man completing a 5 km run at Bengaluru Marathon, saying, "[Sri Dattatreya Ji] truly symbolises the spirit of grit and determination of every Bengalurean." In the video, Surya can be seen holding Dattatreya's hand while they crossed the finish line. Surya added that Dattatreya had "outpaced" many others.

220.title: Karan shares pic of Farah shopping for 'designer wear' on New York Streets
220.article_body: Karan Johar shared a picture of choreographer-director Farah Khan as she shopped on the streets of New York. Taking to Instagram Stories, Karan posted a photo of Farah standing near a roadside shop selling sunglasses. Alongside it, he wrote, "Caught you! Shopping for high-end designer wear! Show off @farahkhankunder." Sharing Karan's post, Farah wrote, "I live for your comments @karanjohar."

221.title: Dozens of Ukrainian civilians found in grave near Kyiv
221.article_body: A grave with dozens of Ukrainian civilians has been found in Buzova village near Kyiv, the latest reported mass grave to be discovered as Russian forces retreat, an official said. Ukraine said Russia is gathering its forces in the east for a major assault and urged people to flee. UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday.

222.title: RCB's Harshal Patel leaves IPL bio-bubble after death of a family member
222.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel has left the IPL bio-bubble following the death of a family member. Harshal exited the bubble after getting to know about the tragedy in the family after the match against MI on Saturday night, PTI reported. Harshal is expected to join the bubble before RCB's next match.

223.title: YouTube blocks Russian parliament's Duma TV; Russia criticises
223.article_body: YouTube has blocked Russia's lower parliament house's broadcast channel Duma TV, saying that it was "terminated" for violating the terms of service. "YouTube has signed its own warrant," Russia's Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said. Russian leader Vyacheslav Volodin also reacted to it, saying that this shows that the US is trying to achieve a "monopoly of information".

224.title: Fire breaks out at Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi for 2nd time in 2 weeks
224.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi on Saturday late night, nearly two weeks after a massive fire broke out at same site which took firefighters nearly 48 hours to extinguish. The Saturday's fire was put out within three hours after Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials sent four fire tenders to the spot within 10-15 minutes.

225.title: We're planning such that foreigners will seek jobs in Punjab: Mann
225.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday called for the stop of the "brain drain" from the state, saying, "We're planning in such...way that foreigners will come here for jobs." Following this, Congress MLA Sukhpal Khaira criticised the remark, saying, "Hope foreigners approach...but...we've to set our house in order." Mann claimed that ₹15 lakh was lost per person going abroad.

226.title: Hope I can move on: Amber shares statement ahead of Johnny Depp Defamation Case
226.article_body: Amber Heard said she hopes she and her ex-husband Johnny Depp can move on from their defamation trials, which are set to begin on April 11. On Saturday, she wrote, "I've always maintained a love for Johnny and it brings me great pain to have to live out the details of our past life together in front of the world."

227.title: IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural fest Antaragni is being held from Apr 8-10
227.article_body: Celebrating its 56th edition with the theme of 'A Nouvelle Rhapsody', IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural festival 'Antaragni' is being conducted in a hybrid mode for the first time ever. It offers a virtually immersive experience of the IIT-Kanpur Campus with all events, online and offline, being streamed on the platform. Key highlights include performances from artists Ritviz and Sunidhi Chauhan.

228.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days
228.article_body: SS Rajamouli-directorial 'RRR' has crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days of its release. The Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' is the third Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' to earn ₹1,000 crore worldwide. 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide earnings.

229.title: Jaffer shares scene from Yuvraj's movie as child actor; jokes about MI, CSK's losses
229.article_body: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a scene from Yuvraj Singh's Punjabi movie 'Mehndi Shagna Di' to joke about MI and CSK losing their first four matches each in IPL 2022. In the scene, Yuvraj, standing with his friend, tells their teacher, "We've taken an oath that if we win, we'll win together, if we lose, we'll lose together."

230.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn marries actress Nicola Peltz, pics from wedding surface
230.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn tied the knot with American actress Nicola Peltz in Palm Beach. Tennis player Serena Williams, Spice Girl Mel C, fashion designer Rachel Zoe and TV chef Gordon Ramsay were among those who attended the wedding ceremony. The couple had got engaged in July 2020.

231.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Indo-Pak border viewing project at Gujarat's Nadabet
231.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Nadabet in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. The viewing point has been made on the lines of the one at Punjab's Wagah Border. According to officials, the project was developed as a tourist attraction destination at a cost of ₹125 crore by Gujarat's tourism department.

232.title: Hope you're blessed with everything: Samantha on Naga's brother Akhil's b'day
232.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who parted ways with her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya in 2021, has penned a note on the occasion of Naga's actor-brother Akhil Akkineni's birthday. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories, wrote, "Happy birthday Akhil. Wishing you the very best this year. I hope and pray you are blessed with everything you are looking for. God Bless."

233.title: We can also take action against Kejriwal in BJP-ruled states: Singh
233.article_body: After Punjab Police booked BJP leader Naveen Jindal, the party's West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has said that BJP can also file FIRs against AAP leaders but the party doesn't believe in "low-level politics". "We've BJP governments in more than half of the states...we can take action against [Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal] there," he added.

234.title: 300-yr-old Karaga festival begins at Bengaluru's Dharmaraya temple
234.article_body: The 300-year-old Karaga festival began at the Dharmaraya Swamy Temple in Bengaluru on Saturday. The festival was held exclusively within the temple in the last two years owing to the Covid-19 pandemic. However this year, the organisers will take out the 'Hasi Karaga' (procession) on April 14 while the 'Karaga Shakyotsava' (the main event) will be held on April 16.

235.title: China records 1,351 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Shanghai
235.article_body: China recorded 1,351 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, including 1,318 locally transmitted and 33 imported infections, said the country's health authorities. Shanghai, which has been put under a strict lockdown, saw 1,006 locally confirmed cases, the highest of all cities. 242 cases were reported in Jilin, 16 in Zhejiang, 10 in Guangdong, and three in Beijing.

236.title: Nana Patekar to make comeback with social-thriller 'The Confession'
236.article_body: Actor Nana Patekar is set to make an acting comeback with a social-thriller, titled 'The Confession'. It will be directed by Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who has helmed films like 'The Xpose', 'Aksar' and 'Dil Maange More!!!'. The 71-year-old actor had reportedly taken a break from acting after actress Tanushree Dutta accused him of sexual harassment during the #MeToo movement.

237.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison calls for elections on May 21
237.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has called for federal elections to be held on May 21. Morrison said that Governor-General David Hurley, who he met on Sunday at his residence, accepted his advice on setting the election date. Following the announcement, the opposition - Australian Labor party - tweeted, "It's time for better Medicare. It's time for better aged care."

238.title: Iceland Cricket mock third umpire over Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal
238.article_body: Iceland Cricket mocked the third umpire over ex-RCB captain Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI. Iceland Cricket tweeted, "It's not easy for on-field umpires to detect inside edges or whether ball hit bat or pad first. But every TV umpire should be able to make the right call with the benefit of slow motion replays and technology like UltraEdge."

239.title: UGC India's Twitter account briefly hacked; 3rd govt account targeted in 2 days
239.article_body: The official Twitter account of University Grants Commission (UGC) India was briefly hacked on Sunday. The account's display and background pictures were changed to photos of cartoons and a long thread of tweets were posted, tagging numerous Twitter users. This comes after the Twitter accounts of Uttar Pradesh CM's Office and India Meteorological Department's (IMD) were hacked on Saturday.

240.title: Big B sends handwritten letter to Nimrat praising her performance in 'Dasvi'
240.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan recently sent a handwritten letter to Nimrat Kaur along with some flowers to praise her 'exceptional work' in her latest film 'Dasvi'.  "Your work in 'Dasvi' is exceptional - nuances, gestures, all! My deep admiration and congratulations," he wrote in the letter. Nimrat also penned a note thanking Amitabh for sending her flowers and letter for the film.

241.title: Musk takes poll to turn Twitter HQ in San Francisco into homeless shelter
241.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a poll on his Twitter account asking whether the firm's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. The poll read, "Convert Twitter SF HQ to homeless shelter since no one shows up anyway." The poll has got over 6.6 lakh votes till now, with over 91% answering yes.

242.title: Aus PM cooks PM Modi's 'favourite khichdi' to celebrate India trade deal, shares pics
242.article_body: Australia PM Scott Morrison took to Instagram to reveal that he celebrated his country's new trade agreement with India by cooking Indian dishes. "The curries I chose to cook for curry night...are all from my dear friend Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Gujarat province, including his favourite khichdi," he wrote. "Good job, looks delicious," an Instagram user commented.

243.title: Won't spare anyone: Telangana Minister to pubs after Hyd drug bust case
243.article_body: After the recent drug bust by the police inside a Hyderabad pub, the state's Tourism and Excise Minister V Srinivas Goud has said that they "won't spare anyone". "If need be, we will shut down everything...It's not about revenues, but the...reputation of Telangana," Goud said during a review meeting with the representatives of various pubs and bars of Hyderabad.

244.title: Johnny Lever, Rajpal Yadav arrive together at an event, fan says 'Comedy Kings'
244.article_body: Actors Johnny Lever and Rajpal Yadav, who have appeared together in films like 'Coolie No.1' and 'Hungama 2' met on Thursday at an event. A paparazzo account shared a video featuring Johnny and Rajpal from the event. The video received a lot of appreciation. One of the fans called them, "The Bollywood legends of laughter." Another user commented, "Comedy Kings."

245.title: CBI books 10 persons over TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
245.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has registered an FIR against 10 persons in connection with TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to the killing of nine persons in West Bengal's Birbhum, a senior official said. The CBI visited Rampurhat police station and collected the case diary and documents linked to Sheikh's murder investigation, the official added.

246.title: Class 10 girl killed by a speeding truck on way to exam in Surat
246.article_body: A Class 10 girl, who was going to the exam centre to write her Hindi board exam, was killed by a speeding truck near Bhesan village road in Surat. The deceased, Pragati Sadashiv (16), was going on a moped with her uncle to Segva village when the truck hit them, police said. Her uncle, Chhagan Rathod, has suffered serious injuries.

247.title: India reports 1,054 new COVID-19 cases, 29 deaths in last 24 hours
247.article_body: India has reported 1,054 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,258 recoveries and 29 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,150 COVID-19 cases and 83 deaths. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 11,132, while the death toll reached 5,21,685.

248.title: Gurugram records 44.5°C, second hottest April day in 43 years
248.article_body: Gurugram witnessed its second hottest day recorded in the month of April in 43 years as the maximum temperature hit 44.5°C on Saturday. According to India Meteorological Department, the last time the city saw a higher temperature was in 1979 when it recorded 44.8°C on April 28. The maximum temperature was 10°C above the average normal, added IMD.

249.title: Right-wing workers vandalise Muslim traders' carts at K'taka temple
249.article_body: Members of the right-wing group, Sri Ram Sene, on Saturday allegedly vandalised the carts of Muslim traders outside a Hanuman temple in Karnataka's Dharwad. A video of the incident was shared online, which shows smashed watermelons on the road. "I've been doing business in front of this temple for...15 years and never had a problem," a watermelon seller said.

250.title: Women police station in Noida gets new daycare centre
250.article_body: A daycare centre for children has been started at the women police station in Noida's Sector 39. This is the second such facility in Gautam Buddha Nagar after the one in Surajpur was opened last year. DCP Vrinda Shukla said that the facility was conceptualised in January and subsequently set up with the help of a private firm.

251.title: Spain's Barcelona to ban smoking on all of its 10 beaches
251.article_body: Authorities in Spain's second-largest city Barcelona have announced that they'll ban smoking on all of the city's 10 beaches from this year. This comes after a pilot project in which smoking was banned at four beaches. "Beaches with no smoking allowed will offer healthier communal living areas, with less waste and will respect the defence of the environment," authorities said.

252.title: Harbhajan Singh asks Ashish Nehra what Rahul Tewatia eats, GT respond with a pic
252.article_body:
After GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia slammed two sixes on the last two deliveries to help his team defeat PBKS, Harbhajan Singh asked GT head coach Ashish Nehra what Tewatia eats. GT responded to Harbhajan with a screengrab from one of their videos wherein Tewatia can be seen eating fafda. "
Psst! It's a secret. Don't tell anyone," GT wrote.

253.title: What does the law say regarding Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI?
253.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli was declared LBW out against MI's Dewald Brevis by third umpire, who stated that he can't overturn on-field umpire's decision as ball hit the bat and pad simultaneously. As per MCC's rules, if the ball makes contact with the striker's pad and bat simultaneously, this shall be considered as the ball having first touched the bat.

254.title: Video shows Ronaldo smashing fan's phone after Manchester United's defeat
254.article_body: A video has surfaced which purportedly shows Cristiano Ronaldo smashing a fan's phone following Manchester United's 1-0 defeat to Everton at Goodison Park on Saturday. "I'd like to apologise for my outburst and, if possible, I would like to invite this supporter to watch a game at Old Trafford as a sign of fair-play and sportsmanship," Ronaldo said on Instagram.

255.title: discovery+ docuseries to uncover lesser-known mysteries around Ramayana
255.article_body: Ahead of Ram Navami, discovery+ has announced its docuseries 'Legends Of The Ramayana' narrated by author Amish Tripathi. Subscribers can watch the series, shot across India and Sri Lanka, to uncover questions like 'what is the name of Shri Rama's sister?,' 'what's the mystery behind Rama Setu stones?,' 'why did Shri Rama's vanvaas last 14 years?' and more such mysteries.

256.title: 5 hurt, several trapped as part of building collapses in Punjab; casualties suspected
256.article_body: At least five persons sustained injuries and several others were left trapped under debris after a portion of an under-construction building of a private university located on Airport Road in Punjab's Mohali collapsed on Saturday late night. Rescue workers were rushed to the spot immediately after the incident. "We suspect that there are casualties," a police officer said.

257.title: I'll be there whenever he wants me: Neetu on working with son Ranbir
257.article_body: When asked if she plans to work with her son, actor Ranbir Kapoor someday, actress Neetu Kapoor said that she would love to do it anytime. "Whenever he wants me, I will be there," she said. Neetu further added that she recently shot an advertisement with Ranbir and she just loved the experience of working with him.

258.title: Shweta Bachchan shares mom Jaya's pic from her NCC days on her b'day
258.article_body: Shweta Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish her mother, Jaya Bachchan, on her 74th birthday. She shared some old pictures of Jaya and wrote, "Mother, may you always smile like you've made best NCC cadet or like you have a huge plate of crabs to devour." Actor Abhishek Bachchan also wished Jaya on her birthday.

259.title: Section 144 imposed in Rajasthan's Jaipur till May 9 after Karauli violence
259.article_body: The Jaipur administration on Saturday imposed Section 144 of CrPC till May 9, in view of the violence that broke out in Rajasthan's Karauli last week, injuring several people. The order has suspended the gathering of crowds, protests, assemblies and processions without prior permission in the area. Wedding celebrations and mournings will be exempted, according to the order.

260.title: Pune records 40 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
260.article_body: Pune district saw 40 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths, the health department said on Saturday. The total number of cases recorded so far stood at around 14.5 lakh, while the death toll from the infection reached 20,538. There are currently 235 active cases. Over 1.78 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the district.

261.title: Big B shaped the way I thought about cinema: KGF 2 director on Sholay
261.article_body: 'KGF 2' director Prashanth Neel spoke about how Ramesh Sippy's 'Sholay' and Amitabh Bachchan changed the way he saw cinema. He said, "Amitabh Bachchan shaped the way I thought about cinema. One thing...Sholay did was, to tell...Indian audience...you can make...Hollywood movies in India with Indian emotions." "I didn't think I'd make KGF this early in my career," he added.

262.title: 466 live corals seized from Dubai passengers at Pune airport
262.article_body: As many as 466 live corals were seized from two passengers arriving from Dubai on April 5 by customs officials at Pune airport. According to an official, at least 100 corals were kept in a glass jar while 366 were in a plastic bag. The corals, protected under Wildlife Protection Act, have been sent for rehabilitation at Mumbai's Taraporevala Aquarium.

263.title: Car crashes into truck in Pune; all 4 occupants of the car killed
263.article_body: All four occupants of a car were killed after the vehicle crashed into a stationary truck from behind at high speed on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway in Pune's Gahunje on Saturday, an official said. "The driver of the truck said that his vehicle had a breakdown after which it had halted," the official added. The incident took place around 3.45 pm.

264.title: Imran Khan left Pakistan PM's official home an hour before losing no-trust vote
264.article_body: Imran Khan vacated the Pakistan Prime Minister's official residence almost an hour before he lost a no-confidence vote in the National Assembly, a senior leader from his party, Faisal Javed Khan, said on Sunday. After Speaker Asad Qaiser handed over the reins to Opposition's Ayaz Sadiq, it seemed the voting on no-trust motion would go ahead and Khan would lose.

265.title: Duo wanted in 25 cases arrested for cheating senior citizens in Navi Mumbai
265.article_body: Two men were arrested for cheating senior citizens by claiming a murder was reported in their area and urging them to hand over their valuables for their own safety. The accused were wanted in 25 cases in Navi Mumbai. They allegedly wrapped the valuables in a handkerchief for the victims and handed over another bundle that had stones or papers.

266.title: Virat Kohli gets angry after controversial dismissal, reaction goes viral
266.article_body: A video of RCB batter Virat Kohli's reaction to his controversial dismissal against MI went viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen smashing bat on the ground in anger and muttering continuously on his way back to the pavilion. Kohli was dismissed LBW after third umpire didn't overturn the original decision, saying ball touched the bat and pad simultaneously.

267.title: Fans question whether Virat Kohli's LBW dismissal against MI was out or not
267.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli was adjudged LBW out by the on-field umpire during his team's match against MI on Saturday. Kohli took a review, with the third umpire sticking with the decision made by the on-field umpire, saying that the ball hit the bat and pad simultaneously. "Kohli is always a victim of controversial LBW calls (atrocious umpiring)," a fan tweeted.

268.title: Traffic on Delhi-Gurugram highway disrupted for hours after crane catches fire
268.article_body: Traffic on the Delhi-Gurugram expressway (NH-48) came to a halt on Saturday after a 50-tonne 18-wheeler hydraulic crane allegedly caught fire near Delhi's Mahipalpur. "We tried removing it with five-seven cranes, but...it couldn't be removed. We've now brought in a larger crane," a police officer said. Commuters going from Gurugram to Delhi reportedly remained stranded for hours on the highway.

269.title: Baby AB takes Virat Kohli's wicket on his first-ever delivery in IPL
269.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, dismissed RCB's Virat Kohli on his first-ever delivery in IPL. Kohli was adjudged LBW out for 48(36) on Brevis' delivery. The South African bowled three deliveries in the match, conceding eight runs and taking a wicket. RCB defeated MI by seven wickets.

270.title: B'luru man who raped 13-yr-old daughter while wife was away jailed
270.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Bengaluru, who is accused of repeatedly raping his 13-year-old daughter while his wife was reportedly at her parental home, has been sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment. The incident occurred in 2015. It is believed that the wife hadn't wanted to report the matter to the police, however, a neighbour informed a child welfare committee.

271.title: Senior police officer removed over protest outside Pawar's Mumbai home
271.article_body: Mumbai Police Joint Commissioner (Law & Order) Vishwas Nangre Patil on Saturday removed DCP (Zone II), Yogesh Kumar, from his post in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside the house of NCP chief Sharad Pawar in Mumbai. Neelotpal, DCP (Detection) of Mumbai Police Crime Branch, has been given the post. Kumar was removed for failing to discharge duties.

272.title: Imran Khan removed as Pakistan Prime Minister after losing no-trust vote
272.article_body: Imran Khan has been removed as Pakistan Prime Minister after he lost the no-trust vote against him in Pakistan's National Assembly. The results of the vote were declared at around 1.30 am IST, with 174 members favouring the resolution of no-trust. With this, Imran became the first Prime Minister in Pakistan's history to be ousted through a no-confidence motion.

273.title: RCB hand MI their 4th straight defeat in IPL 2022, jump to 3rd on the points table
273.article_body: RCB defeated MI by seven wickets to register their third straight victory in IPL 2022. RCB have jumped to the third spot on the points table, while MI joined CSK in losing their first four matches of IPL 2022. Opener Anuj Rawat top-scored for RCB with 66*(47) as RCB chased down the 152-run target in 18.3 overs.

274.title: Global pledging event raises $11 bn to support Ukrainians amid war
274.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Saturday said that a global pledging event raised 10.1 billion euros (nearly $11 billion) to support Ukrainian refugees and internally displaced people in Ukraine. The 'Stand Up For Ukraine' event was convened by the EU and Canadian PM Justin Trudeau. More than 44 lakh people have fled the conflict in Ukraine.

275.title: We'll devise our best plan vs KKR: DC fast bowling coach Hopes
275.article_body: DC fast bowling coach James Hopes said his side will "devise" the best plan against KKR and will look to win the key moments on Sunday. "KKR are a good team...they have two world-class spinners surrounded by a very solid pace attack and some batters who are match-winners," he added. "We haven't played our best cricket yet," Hopes further said.

276.title: AR Rahman's tweet on 'Goddess Tamil' goes viral after Amit Shah's Hindi remark
276.article_body: An illustration of 'Thamizhanangu' (Goddess Tamil) shared by AR Rahman has gone viral on Twitter. Rahman also included a line written by modern Tamil poet Bharathidasan which read, "Beloved Tamil is the root of our existence." This comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.

277.title: Ross Taylor replies in Hindi to Sachin Tendulkar's tweet on his retirement
277.article_body: Former New Zealand batter Ross Taylor took to Twitter to reply in Hindi to Sachin Tendulkar's congratulatory tweet following his retirement. "Shukria Sachin Bhai, aap ki recognition ke liye," Taylor wrote. He further wrote in English, "To get this message from my favourite player growing up is an absolute honour."

278.title: Relegation-threatened Everton beat Man Utd 1-0 in Premier League
278.article_body: Everton on Saturday beat Manchester United 1-0 in the Premier League to boost their chances of avoiding relegation. Everton are currently 17th in the table, now four points above the relegation zone. Everton's Anthony Gordon scored the winner in the 27th minute. Manchester United are in seventh place after the defeat, three points off fourth place.

279.title: My Infosys stake is testament to my father Narayana Murthy's work: Akshata
279.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty said, "My long-standing shareholding in Infosys is not just a financial investment but also testament to my father's (NR Narayana Murthy) work." The couple recently faced criticism over Akshata's 0.9% stake in Infosys and her non-domicile status. Akshata has said that she will start paying UK taxes on all her overseas income.

280.title: Janhvi Kapoor mobbed ahead of store inauguration in Lucknow: Report
280.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor was mobbed by fans and guests ahead of inaugurating a store at a mall in Lucknow, reported ETimes. As per the report, the actress was an hour and a half late for the event and the guests outnumbered the bouncers. The store spokesperson stated that Janhvi's arrival was delayed so she only did a photoshoot and left.

281.title: Jordan's King to undergo urgent surgery for slipped disc in Germany
281.article_body: Jordan's King Abdullah II will undergo urgent surgery for a slipped disc in the back at a hospital in Germany, an official statement announced. "His Majesty had previously been experiencing intermittent pain in the spinal cord after years of parachuting while serving in...Special Forces," it said. "The surgery will be followed by rest for around a week," it added.

282.title: 'RRR' has given 21st century a new pair of Jai-Veeru: Javed Akhtar
282.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar spoke at the 'RRR' success party saying that besides making a memorable film and a game-changer, director SS Rajamouli has given the 21st century another pair of Jai and Veeru. "There are a few films, stars, and directors who are remembered forever," he added. Rajamouli greeted Javed with a hug and touched his feet.

283.title: No one is telling us why he was shot dead: Father of 21-year-old Indian killed in Canada
283.article_body: Jitesh Vasudev, the father of 21-year-old Kartik who was shot dead in Canada, said, "No one is telling us why a young boy was shot dead." He said, "I've received no phone call from Embassy or Canadian authorities." He added, "His bag was left behind and it seems it was not a robbery. It's possible it was a hate crime."

284.title: MI and DC have weakened bowling departments in IPL 2022: Shastri
284.article_body: Ravi Shastri has said MI and DC are the two teams that have a "weakened" bowling department in IPL 2022. He explained that MI without Hardik and Krunal Pandya and Trent Boult are "feeling the heat" as they're lacking that firepower to push. He added that DC are also feeling the same as don't have Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje.

285.title: Owner arrested after pics show horse travelling by train in Bengal
285.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Gafoor Ali Mollah, was arrested by RPF on Friday after pictures showed a horse travelling by train in West Bengal. Mollah's horse travelled 23 km via train after participating in a race. "He has been booked under various sections of Railway Act for creating nuisance in railway property and unauthorised occupation in a train," an official said.

286.title: We're like brothers: Ajay Devgn on being friends with contemporaries
286.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn, speaking about rivalry with his contemporaries, has said that they are all like brothers and are there for each other. He added that he had called Salman Khan a few years ago about releasing a film on Eid. "So many times, Akshay (Kumar) tweets for me, I do for him and others," the actor stated.

287.title: 2 militant associates of Lashkar-e-Taiba arrested in J&K
287.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday arrested two militant associates of terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) from Beerwah in Budgam district, police said. Incriminating material of LeT, arms and ammunition, including a Chinese pistol and 12 pistol rounds, have been seized from their possession, police added. A case has been registered and an investigation has been launched into the matter.

288.title: We need to work hard on our game: Jadeja on CSK's 4th straight loss
288.article_body: Following CSK's fourth consecutive defeat in IPL 2022, captain Ravindra Jadeja said the team needs to sit down and talk. "I think tomorrow might be a day off. We'll look to improve in both departments...we are all professional cricketers, we need to work hard on our game," he added. Jadeja is yet to lead CSK to a win as captain.

289.title: Jharkhand to hold three-tier panchayat polls from May 14 to 27
289.article_body: The three-tier panchayat polls in Jharkhand will be held from May 14 to May 27 in four phases, the State Election Commission (SEC) announced. Notably, 9,470 seats will be added to the open category as the polls will be held without any reservations for OBCs. The reservations for the seats have been removed in compliance with a Supreme Court order.

290.title: Delhi sees hottest day in 72 yrs in April 1st half with max temperature at 42.4°C
290.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi reached 42.4°C on Saturday, making it the hottest day of April's first half in 72 years. Today's temperature broke the previous record for April 1-15 of 41.6°C, recorded on April 8 this year, and April 12 and 13 in 2010. IMD has said that Delhi recorded April's hottest day in five years on Saturday.

291.title: Efforts to unite Opp'n parties have not materialised yet: RJD
291.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Saturday said that the efforts to unite the Opposition have not materialised yet. "Opposition parties have to clear their vision for unemployment, inflation, and a better economy, only then opposition unity is possible," he added. Earlier, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had said discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against the PM and RSS.

292.title: Which are the 10 highest-grossing Indian films worldwide?
292.article_body: According to trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide collection. It's followed by 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' with over ₹1,810 crore and the recently-released 'RRR', which is nearing the ₹1,000-crore mark. 'RRR' is followed by 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', 'Secret Superstar', 'PK', '2.0' and 'Baahubali: The Beginning'.

293.title: All-round game: Jaffer on SRH opener Abhishek's 50-ball 75 vs CSK
293.article_body: Praising Abhishek Sharma for his 50-ball 75 in SRH's eight-wicket win against CSK in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer said it was an all-round game by the SRH opener. "Well played Abhishek! Sweet striker of the ball but packs a punch too. You saw the pull...lofted cover drive...big slog sweep and the flat batted shot over long on," he tweeted.

294.title: Rahul Tewatia should be nicknamed 'Iceman': Sunil Gavaskar
294.article_body: Referring to Rahul Tewatia slamming two sixes on the last two deliveries to help GT defeat PBKS, Sunil Gavaskar said, "What is running through his veins? It's not blood. Ice!" He added, "Tewatia should be nicknamed 'Iceman'." He added, "If there was anybody who was going to take Gujarat home, it was going to be Tewatia."

295.title: Who was Kartik Vasudev, the 21-year-old Indian shot dead in Canada?
295.article_body: Kartik Vasudev, a 21-year-old student from Ghaziabad was shot multiple times outside a subway station in Toronto. Vasudev arrived in Canada in January to study global business marketing and management at Seneca University. He had completed his undergraduate education from IP University in Delhi. Kartik's family said he was a quiet boy who never got into any fights at school.

296.title: The notion of success is very different now: Suchitra Krishnamoorthi
296.article_body: Actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, who starred in 1994 film 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa', has said that the notion, concept and consumption of success are very different now. "Now it's not only about films, there are other mediums like TV or OTT to explore one's creativity. I see youngsters on Instagram, YouTube and other mediums doing so well," the actress added.

297.title: I thanked MSD, he said 'I had nothing to do with the decision': Uthappa on CSK buying him
297.article_body: Robin Uthappa revealed that two days after IPL mega auction, MS Dhoni called him to welcome him to CSK. "I said, 'Thank you for having faith in me'. He said, 'I had nothing to do with this decision'," Uthappa added. "Dhoni said, 'If I've anything to do with the decision...people will...think I picked you because you're my friend'," Uthappa stated.

298.title: Anyone will be happy to get him: SRH debutant Jansen on dismissing Dhoni
298.article_body: Pacer Marco Jansen, who took MS Dhoni's wicket on his SRH debut in IPL 2022, said anyone will be happy to dismiss the CSK wicketkeeper-batter. "Nervous at the start, but nice to get the opportunity...there wasn't much swing for me, so I went for...cross-seam route," he added. The 21-year-old pacer posted bowling figures of 4-0-30-1. Dhoni was dismissed at three.

299.title: 4.1-magnitude earthquake hits Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi
299.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.1 on the Richter scale hit Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Saturday, the National Centre for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. According to the NCS, the earthquake took place at 4:52 pm at a depth of 10 kilometres and around 30 kilometres North-West of Uttarkashi. However, no reports of damage or loss of lives have been reported yet.

300.title: It was some exhibition of quality shots: Irfan on Abhishek's 75 vs CSK
300.article_body: Reacting to Abhishek Sharma's 50-ball 75 against CSK in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "That was some exhibition of quality shots." The SunRisers Hyderabad opener hit five fours and three sixes during his innings. He was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in SRH's eight-wicket win against CSK at DY Patil Stadium. Notably, It is Abhishek's maiden IPL half-century.

301.title: Most of the 'top' accounts rarely tweet, is Twitter dying?: Elon Musk
301.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk responded to a tweet listing the top 10 most followed Twitter accounts and said, "Most of these 'top' accounts tweet rarely and post very little content." "Is Twitter dying?" Musk, who is now Twitter's largest shareholder, asked. The list was topped by Barack Obama with 131.4 million followers, followed by Justin Bieber and Katy Perry.

302.title: Ghana's viral 'Coffin Dance' meme sells as NFT for $1.04 million
302.article_body: The viral 'Coffin Dance' meme has been auctioned as an NFT (non-fungible token) for 327 Ethereum worth $1.04 million. The video, which shows Ghanian pallbearers dancing while carrying a coffin, went viral during COVID-19. The pallbearers will donate 50% of the proceeds from auction to a Ukrainian charity and their friends in Ukraine, who lost their income after Russian invasion.

303.title: Wrote a letter to Satyajit Ray as a teen but never sent it: Vidya
303.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that she wrote a letter to Oscar-winning late filmmaker Satyajit Ray as a teenager but she never sent it. "If I write a letter to Mr Ray today, it would read 'I wish you had lived longer'," the actress added. She further said that she would have loved to work with the filmmaker even today.

304.title: Iran will continue to develop its nuclear industry, says Prez
304.article_body: Iran will continue to develop its nuclear industry for peaceful purposes, according to Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi. "Our knowledge and technology in the nuclear field is not reversible," he said on Saturday. Raisi's comments came as talks between Iran and world powers in Austria's Vienna to revive the 2015 nuclear deal have stalled.

305.title: 'RRR' nears ₹1,000-crore mark, becomes 3rd highest-grossing Indian film: Report
305.article_body: 'RRR' film's worldwide box office earnings hit ₹981.67 crore and it's nearing the ₹1000-crore mark, trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted on Saturday. 'RRR' beat 'Secret Superstar' and 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' to become the third highest-grossing Indian film of all time, he added. 'RRR' is now reportedly the third-highest grossing Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

306.title: Video shows drunk man beating police officer in Indore; arrested
306.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which shows 25-year-old Dinesh Prajapati hitting a police constable, Jai Prakash Jaiswal, after snatching the latter's baton in Indore. The incident happened on Friday afternoon when the motorbikes of both hit one another. Police said Prajapati has been arrested, adding that he was drunk. Jaiswal suffered serious injuries to the head.

307.title: Sri Lanka appoint Chris Silverwood as head coach for 2 years
307.article_body: Ex-England head coach Chris Silverwood has been appointed as head coach of Sri Lanka for a two-year period, the country's cricket board announced on Saturday. Upcoming Sri Lanka-Bangladesh two-match Test series will be Silverwood's first assignment. "I'm very excited to be on board with Sri Lanka...I cannot wait to get over to Colombo and get started," said Silverwood.

308.title: India Meteorological Dept's Twitter account hacked, link to NFT drop shared
308.article_body: The official Twitter handle of India Meteorological Department (IMD) was hacked on Saturday. Hackers removed the profile picture and name from the account. They shared a link to an NFT (non-fungible token) airdrop of the "Beanz Official Collection". Earlier today, the account of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office was briefly hacked and its profile picture was changed to 'Bored Ape'.

309.title: Better.com, which fired 900 staff over a Zoom call, plans to cut its staff further
309.article_body: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which fired 900 employees over a Zoom call last year and began firing 3,000 India and US employees last month, plans to cut its workforce further. It's offering some employees as much as 60 days of severance pay and health insurance if they agree to quit. A Better.com spokesperson confirmed the voluntary separation offers to Bloomberg.

310.title: Manchester City-Liverpool PL game biggest of the season: Foden
310.article_body: Ahead of Manchester City-Liverpool Premier League match, Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden said it's the "biggest game" that every footballer wants to play in. "Two teams fighting for the Premier League, very close on points," he added. Table-toppers Manchester City are on 73 points, with just one point lead over second-placed Liverpool. The match will be played on Sunday.

311.title: Decade-old Hindu temple vandalised in Jammu, case registered
311.article_body: A decade-old temple on the outskirts of Jammu was allegedly vandalised by unidentified miscreants on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday, prompting police to file a case. The temple priest noticed the damage caused to the idols in the morning. Police urged people to maintain communal harmony and foil designs of those trying to disturb the peace.

312.title: UK PM Boris Johnson meets Ukraine President Zelenskyy in Kyiv, pic surfaces
312.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a visit to Kyiv on Saturday. The embassy of Ukraine in London shared a photo of the two leaders meeting face to face, with the caption, "Surprise." "Boris Johnson's visit in Kyiv began just now with a tete-a-tete meeting with President Zelenskyy," an aide of Ukraine President said on Facebook.

313.title: All institutions in hands of RSS, we have to protect them: Rahul
313.article_body: During a book launch event in Delhi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday alleged that all institutions in India are in the hands of the RSS. He said, "We've to protect the Constitution...To save the Constitution, we've to protect our institutions...But all the institutions are in...hands of RSS." Earlier, Rahul had said that Opposition parties must unite to fight BJP.

314.title: Video shows speeding BMW hitting woman on 2-wheeler after jumping divider in Mangaluru
314.article_body: A CCTV footage has emerged which shows a speeding BMW car jumping over a divider and hitting a woman on a two-wheeler and crashing into another car in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. The video shows another woman, who was standing on the divider, narrowly escaping from being hit by the speeding car. The woman on the two-wheeler suffered critical injuries.

315.title: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claims pole position in Aus GP qualifying
315.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc on Saturday took pole position ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished third ahead of McLaren's Lando Norris in fourth. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton came fifth with teammate George Russell finishing sixth. "We are again very close with Red Bull," said Leclerc.

316.title: Warnock retires from football aged 73 after 42-year managerial career
316.article_body: Former Queens Park Rangers, Crystal Palace and Sheffield United manager Neil Warnock on Saturday, announced his retirement from football, at the age of 73, after a 42-year managerial career. Warnock has managed more matches in English professional football than anyone else with over 1,600 games. He began his managerial career in 1980. "I've had a good run really," he said.

317.title: Over 44 lakh people fled Ukraine since start of war, says UN
317.article_body: More than 44 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of the war in February, according to the UN refugee agency. Of these, around 2.1 lakh are non-Ukrainians. Around 90% of those who have fled Ukraine are women and children, as the Ukrainian authorities do not allow men of military age to leave, according to AFP.

318.title: Mumbai Police records Sanjay Raut's statement in phone tapping case
318.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Saturday recorded the statement on senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut at the office of the party's mouthpiece Saamna. Raut is one of the two politicians whose phones were allegedly tapped illegally by the Maharashtra Intelligence Department when IPS officer Rashmi Shukla was its chief. The recording lasted for nearly one hour, a police officer said.

319.title: Didn't really feel good in the car: Max Verstappen ahead of Aus GP
319.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen said he "didn't really feel good in the car" as he finished second behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix on Saturday. "I think there's not been one lap where I actually felt confident, a bit of a struggle," Verstappen said ahead of the Grand Prix on Sunday.

320.title: Boris Becker found guilty of four charges in bankruptcy trial in London
320.article_body: Six-time Grand Slam champion Boris Becker was found guilty of four charges in his bankruptcy trial in London after being accused of hiding millions of pounds worth of assets including two Wimbledon trophies to avoid paying debts. Becker, 54, was acquitted of further 20 counts. He was made bankrupt on June 21, 2017. Becker had previously denied the charges.

321.title: Employees shouldn't feel pressured to answer emails late at night: Nadella
321.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that managers need to set clear norms and expectations for workers so they're not pressured to answer emails late at night. "We know what stress does to workers. We need to learn the soft skills," he added. When asked if he refrains from sending emails on the weekend, Nadella said, "I'm learning every day."

322.title: IT firm Kissflow gifts BMWs to 5 senior employees to honour their loyalty
322.article_body: Chennai-based IT firm Kissflow has gifted BMW cars worth over ₹1 crore each to five of its senior employees to honour their loyalty and commitment to the company. Kissflow CEO Suresh Sambandam said these employees have been with him right from the company's inception. Some of them hail from humble background and underwent various challenges before joining Kissflow, Sambandam added.

323.title: Hats off to determination: Jay on India's win vs Netherlands in Pro League
323.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter to congratulate India after they defeated reigning world and Olympic champions Netherlands 2-1 in the first match of their double leg tie at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League on Friday. "Hats off to the determination of team India to come out on top," he wrote. Navneet Kaur was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

324.title: Tourists visiting J&K due to CRPF's hard work, says Home Secy
324.article_body: Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla on Saturday said it's due to the hard work of CRPF that many tourists are visiting J&K and that there's a sense of security in the Union Territory. Bhalla also praised security forces for neutralising "many hardcore terrorists" in J&K over the past year. A huge quantity of arms were also seized, he added.

325.title: SRH register biggest win by wickets in IPL 2022, CSK lose 4th match in a row
325.article_body: SRH registered their first win in IPL 2022 by defeating CSK by eight wickets on Saturday. It is the biggest win by wickets in the tournament so far. CSK have now lost four matches in a row. SRH opener Abhishek Sharma top-scored in the match with 75(50) as SRH chased down the 155-run target in 17.4 overs.

326.title: RCB to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash, Glenn Maxwell returns
326.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash. RCB have made one change to their playing XI, with Glenn Maxwell replacing Sherfane Rutherford. MI have made two changes to their playing XI, with Jaydev Unadkat replacing Tymal Mills and Ramandeep Singh replacing Daniel Sams.

327.title: What is a US green card that Rishi Sunak admitted he held as UK Finance Minister?
327.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak admitted that he held a US green card for over 18 months after becoming a UK government minister. Officially known as the Permanent Resident Card, a green card grants foreign nationals the right to live and work permanently in the United States. A green card holder is considered a resident of US for tax purposes.

328.title: 132 tortured bodies found in town freed from Russian forces: Ukraine
328.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has accused Russian forces of leaving behind "tormented bodies" in the town of Makariv in the Kyiv region. It said that as Ukrainian rescuers are advancing in areas liberated by Russian forces, new "war crimes are [being] uncovered". "The town of Makariv is half-ruined. 132 tormented bodies of tortured, murdered citizens have already been found," it said.

329.title: MSRTC worker found dead near bus depot in Mumbai
329.article_body: A 43-year-old bus conductor of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), identified as Mahesh Lal, was found dead near the Parel Bus Depot in Mumbai. He had come to Mumbai from Kolhapur a few days ago to participate in the agitation outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house. Police don't suspect foul play but have registered a case of accidental death.

330.title: Mock drills conducted in Delhi to counter terrorist attacks
330.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that security agencies conducted mock drills in the national capital to counter terrorist attacks. Police said that the mega counter-terror mock drill was named 'Exercise All Out' and was executed at multiple locations. The police stated that there will be simulated terror attacks at various markets, institutions and offices across Delhi.

331.title: Sri Lanka's Opp'n threats no-trust vote against govt amid crisis
331.article_body: Sri Lanka's main opposition party on Friday said that it would move a no-confidence motion against the government if it does not take measures to address the severe economic crisis in the country. "We have called a meeting with all opposition leaders and will take a final decision on it soon," Sajith Premadasa, chief of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), said.

332.title: Had I not conceded runs, wouldn't have got chance to hit sixes: GT's Tewatia
332.article_body: Following GT's six-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he wouldn't have got the chance to hit sixes in final two balls against PBKS if he hadn't conceded 24 runs in his single over. Tewatia scored a 3-ball 13*. GT are the only team who haven't lost a match in IPL 2022 so far.

333.title: Don't know which one of our cousins refused to give shoes to Babar Azam: Umar Akmal
333.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan captain Babar Azam claiming a cousin once refused to lend him shoes during his formative years in cricket, Umar Akmal, one of Babar's cousins, said, "I've no idea which cousin refused to give shoes to Babar." He added, "We've always offered support to relatives who wanted to play cricket. I've never turned down a request."

334.title: Leone shares her wedding pic, says 'opened wedding envelopes to pay for reception'
334.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a picture from her wedding to celebrate her 11th marriage anniversary with Daniel Weber. In the caption, the actress wrote, "11 years married today! A time when we had no money, less than 50 guests...opening wedding envelopes to pay for our reception." "A reminder of how far we've come together," she added.

335.title: Pune woman kills 4-month-old kitten, says, 'it used to make noise'
335.article_body: Pune Police have booked a woman for allegedly killing a four-month-old kitten. According to the police, she hit the kitten's head with a blunt object after it entered her house. The woman reportedly told the police that the kitten used to come to her house often and made "noise". Police registered the case after the woman's neighbour filed the complaint.

336.title: Cong burns effigies of Amitabh, Akshay Kumar for not protesting fuel price hikes
336.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress burnt the effigies of Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar for allegedly being selective in their criticism of fuel price hikes and inflation. "In 2012, these actors used to tweet against fuel price hikes and inflation...At that time, an LPG cylinder used to cost ₹300-400, while petrol and diesel was around ₹60/litre," said Congress MLA PC Sharma.

337.title: Ricky Gervais, 50 Cent support Will Smith after 10 year Oscar ban
337.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for the next 10 years, Ricky Gervais and 50 Cent among others have tweeted in support of him. "Hopefully, he'll only do 6 years with good behaviour," Ricky tweeted. 50 Cent wrote, "This is too harsh...He can't come back till he 63 years old. And the lawsuit ain't even hit yet."

338.title: TMC leader says, 'We can blow up area in 10 mins'; Malviya shares video
338.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Saturday shared a video wherein a TMC leader purportedly said, "Don't worry we have so much stock of bombs and guns that we can blow up the whole area in 10 minutes." He claimed the comments were made by TMC's Deputy Pradhan Sakir Ahmad. "West Bengal under Mamata Banerjee is waiting to explode," Malviya wrote.

339.title: AAP lost deposits in UP, it'll lose in Himachal also: Anurag Thakur
339.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the BJP will retain power in Himachal Pradesh by winning the upcoming state Assembly elections. Further speaking about Aam Aadmi Party, Thakur said, "AAP has lost deposits in Uttar Pradesh and it will lose in Himachal Pradesh also." Notably, AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari joined BJP on Friday.

340.title: Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy: Kajal Aggarwal
340.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture from her maternity photoshoot, writing, "Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy." The actress further wrote, "One moment you feel like you have everything under control, while the next moment, you're so drained." Kajal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu are expecting their first child together.

341.title: MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Bumrah well in IPL: Irfan
341.article_body: Irfan Pathan said MI know how to make a comeback after having lost three straight matches in IPL 2022. "In IPL 2015, they were in a similar situation...that team was a little different. This year, MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Jasprit Bumrah well. This is a major headache for...captain," he added. MI will face RCB today.

342.title: Don't expect Russia to be removed from UN Security Council: US
342.article_body: The White House on Friday said that it does not anticipate Russia to be suspended from the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Notably, Russia is among the five permanent members of the UNSC and has veto power. Earlier, Russia was suspended from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

343.title: A scene was cut off in a film, made my character look strange: Jacqueline
343.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez revealed that a filmmaker once cut her scene which made her character look very strange. Without naming the film, Jacqueline said her character had a quirk but the scene explaining it was chopped off. "A director friend came later and asked me about it and I said I have an explanation but it's too late," she added.

344.title: Imran not in his senses anymore, must be treated as psychopath: Nawaz Sharif's daughter
344.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has tweeted, "One person who is not in his senses anymore cannot be allowed to wreak havoc & bring the entire country down." She added, "He shouldn't be treated as PM or ex-PM, he must be treated as a psychopath who just to save his own skin is holding the entire country hostage."

345.title: I have a great bonding with SRK, he's a great listener: Sonu Sood
345.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has said that he has a great bonding with actor Shah Rukh Khan, adding that the latter is a great listener. Sonu added that the two spent a lot of time together while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. "He really takes care of you as an elder brother, as a producer," Sonu said.

346.title: Russia expels 45 Polish diplomats in a tit-for-tat move
346.article_body: Russia has expelled 45 Polish embassy and consulate staff and declared them "persona non grata", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Poland expelled the same number of Russian diplomats in March. Poland had said the Russian diplomats were suspected of working for Russian intelligence. Russia has given the diplomats time till April 13 to leave the country.

347.title: I don't know about the big day myself: Neetu on Ranbir-Alia's wedding
347.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, when asked about her actor-son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding to actress Alia Bhatt, told ETimes, "I would like to celebrate it and say it out loud. But kids today are different." She added, "I don't know about the big day myself, as both are very private people." She also said, "Alia and Ranbir are made for each other."

348.title: We've become debt-free, repaid ₹2,925 crore loans: Ruchi Soya
348.article_body: Edible oil major Ruchi Soya has said that it has repaid ₹2,925 crore loans to banks and has become a debt-free company. The money was paid to a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India. Baba Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved-led Ruchi Soya has recently raised ₹4,300 crore through its follow-on public offer.

349.title: Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of MI: Harbhajan Singh
349.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said MI batter Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of the franchise, referring to his 'Main Hoon Na' celebration in IPL 2020. "When he first came he was a bit fat but Suryakumar has lost a lot of weight in the past few years, and worked a lot [on] his game," added Harbhajan.

350.title: Will take strict action: Yogi govt after UP CMO's Twitter account hacked
350.article_body: After the Twitter account of UP CM's Office was briefly hacked, CM Yogi Adityanath-led state government said strict action will be taken against those responsible. The breach came to light when unidentified hackers published a post based on a tutorial called "How to turn your BAYC/MAYC animated on Twitter" on the CMO's account. They also changed the account's profile picture.

351.title: Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since invasion began: Ukraine
351.article_body: Ukrainian officials have claimed that Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since its invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Officials said Russia has also lost 1,891 armoured personnel vehicles, 700 tanks and 135 helicopters.
