Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday admitted that Russia had suffered "significant losses of troops" in what Russia calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine.

352.title: European Union to resume diplomatic presence in Kyiv
352.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Friday announced that it will resume its diplomatic presence in Kyiv. Notably, the EU's decision comes after a retreat by Russian forces from areas around the Ukrainian capital recently. The EU had moved its diplomatic mission to Poland after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 following months of tensions.

353.title: Govt websites hacked as Ukraine Prez addressed Parliament: Finland
353.article_body: Finland's government website and those of several ministries were hit by a cyberattack at the same time that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was giving a video address to the Parliament on Friday, the government said. However, the situation has been normalised, Finland's Foreign Ministry said. Finland on Friday also reported a violation of Finnish airspace by a Russian state aircraft.

354.title: Will bring the best content for people: Ayushmann on upcoming projects
354.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, while talking about his upcoming projects, said he is confident that he will be bringing the best content for people to watch in 2022. "I have always looked to handpick projects that are out of the ordinary," Ayushmann said. The actor will be seen in three upcoming films, titled, 'Anek', 'Doctor G' and 'Action Hero'.

355.title: Germany may reintroduce COVID-19 measures in fall: Health Minister
355.article_body: Health Minister Karl Lauterbach on Friday said Germany may reintroduce certain COVID-19 measures such as mask-wearing in public in the fall when cases are expected to rise. German lawmakers on Thursday voted against imposing a COVID-19 vaccination mandate on people aged 60 and older. The mandate was supported by both German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Lauterbach.

356.title: Tom Holland buys Porsche Taycan Turbo S worth ₹2.13 cr, shares pic
356.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has purchased a Porsche Taycan Turbo S which is worth ₹2.13 crore. He took to Instagram to share a picture of the car, writing, "'Electric' Peter Kay. Thanks Porsche for helping me go electric." As per a report, Tom also owns an Audi RS7, Audi RS7 Sportback, Audi Q7, Audi R8 and Rolls Royce Cullinan Black Badge.

357.title: Four booked for gang-raping differently-abled woman in Gujarat
357.article_body: Police booked four men for allegedly gang-raping a woman in her late twenties, who is speech and hearing impaired, multiple times in Gujarat's Mehsana. The woman's son had informed his father about the incident, police said. When her husband confronted the accused, they threatened to kill the couple and their child and forced them to leave Mehsana, police added.

358.title: Sec 144 imposed after stones pelted at Shobha Yatra in Karnataka
358.article_body: After stones were allegedly pelted at the Rama Shobha Yatra procession on Friday night, prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 were imposed in Karnataka's Mulbagal.  According to the police, five people have been taken into custody till now. "As there was a disruption in the electricity supply, some miscreants may have taken advantage," Kolar SP D Devaraj said.

359.title: Central agencies looking into hoax bomb threat to B'luru schools: Min
359.article_body: After several schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via email, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra today said that central agencies are looking into the matter. Jnanendra added that police are trying to find out who was behind the hoax threat. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state.

360.title: UN seeks $80 million to prevent oil spill disaster off Yemen coast
360.article_body: The UN said it is seeking $80 million from donor nations to fund an emergency operation to remove a million barrels of crude oil from a tanker anchored off the coast of Yemen. An oil spill from the FSO Safer tanker "would unleash a massive ecological and humanitarian catastrophe", UN Resident and Humanitarian Coordinator for Yemen, David Gressly said.

361.title: BJP's personal agenda is to prioritise Hindi over other languages: HD Kumaraswamy
361.article_body: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has criticised Home Minister Amit Shah over his statement that Hindi should be an alternative to English. Kumaraswamy also accused the BJP-led Centre of imposing their "personal agendas" on citizens. "Central government...(is) actually trying to forcibly run their personal agendas. But they won't succeed. People will teach them a lesson," he said.

362.title: Used to sneak out silently when Happy New Year cast went to party: Sonu
362.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has stated that people find it very difficult to take him to parties. The actor said that they were travelling while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year', Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone used to say, 'Let's go party'. "I used to sneak out silently. It's very difficult to party with me," Sonu added.

363.title: Odisha to establish hockey clubs in schools across all districts
363.article_body: Ahead of the FIH Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar, the Odisha government is all set to launch its 'Mo School Hockey Club' programme. The programme aims to establish a hockey club in at least one school of each district. There will be around 24-30 students in each wing of the club selected from Class 6 onwards, officials said.

364.title: Sebastian Vettel fined ₹4.12 lakh for riding scooter on Australian F1 track
364.article_body: Aston Martin driver Sebastian Vettel has been fined €5,000 (₹4.12 lakh) for riding a scooter on the Albert Park circuit following the conclusion of Free Practice 1 for the Australian Grand Prix on Friday. Vettel had borrowed the scooter from the marshals. The four-time champion was deemed to have broken Article 26.7 of the Sporting Regulations of Formula One.

365.title: Ram Charan to play double role in Shankar's 'RC15': Report
365.article_body: Actor Ram Charan will reportedly play a double role in Shankar Shanmugham's upcoming project tentatively titled 'RC15'. According to reports, the actor will be seen portraying the role of an officer and a student in the bilingual political drama. Written by Karthik Subbaraj, the film's music will be composed by S Thaman. It will also feature Kiara Advani.

366.title: Jamia ties up with digital online learning firm to impart skills to students
366.article_body: The Jamia Millia Islamia's placement cell has tied up with an online digital learning platform, IBM Skills Build-CSRBOX Foundation, to equip its students with essential technical skills. “The collaboration will facilitate the delivery of free digital learning to JMI students through the acquisition of essential skills like technical, professional and job readiness skills,” JMI said in a statement.

367.title: Chip undersupply to last until 2024: Volkswagen CFO
367.article_body: Volkswagen Chief Financial Officer Arno Antlitz has said that the supply of semiconductors is unlikely to completely meet the demands again until 2024. "The structural undersupply will likely only resolve itself in 2024," Antlitz said. He added that some issues might begin to ease towards 2022-end, with production returning to 2019 levels next year.

368.title: Nothing to worry: K'taka CM after Pai seeks PM's help over B'luru roads
368.article_body: Reacting to Information Technology industry veteran TV Mohandas Pai's remarks on Bengaluru's roads, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is no such reason to worry. Bommai also assured that there will be large-scale road repair works in the city in the coming days. Notably, Pai had tweeted, "[Bengaluru's] roads are bad and traffic sucks...[PM Narendra Modi, please intervene and help]."

369.title: NASA to resume crucial Artemis 1 Moon mission's 'wet dress rehearsal'
369.article_body: NASA will be resuming its 'wet dress rehearsal' for Artemis 1 Moon mission today. It began the rehearsal, a practice run of the most important prelaunch activities, last Friday. However, the attempt was suspended after a valve issue surfaced during tanking. The rehearsal includes a full countdown, loading the rocket's tanks with supercold propellant and draining the rocket tanks.

370.title: 'Mud volcano' erupts at a temple in Taiwan; video goes viral
370.article_body: A video of a 'mud volcano' that erupted at a temple in the Pingtung County of southern Taiwan has gone viral on social media platforms. The video showed the eruption spewed large amounts of mud and water above ground that flowed into surrounding roads and fields. The bursts reached as high as a one-storey building.

371.title: WMA writes to PM Modi, seeks solution against violence on doctors
371.article_body: The World Medical Association has written to PM Narendra Modi asking him to address violence against doctors in India. "Countering non-negligent treatment errors with prosecution...is not only unjust but will also have grave consequences," the letter read. "We observe an increasing rate of violence against [doctors]...This is a serious situation," said Dr Otmar Kloiber, WMA Secretary-General.

372.title: Plenty of unused COVID vaccine doses, won't buy fresh stock: Pune hospitals
372.article_body: Private hospitals in Pune have reportedly claimed that they have plenty of unused COVID-19 vaccine doses and are reluctant to order fresh stock. "We have 5,000-6,000 doses...and hardly 10 people are coming each day," Ruby Hall Clinic's CEO Bomi Bhote said. "We will be ordering after we've exhausted our pending stock of 3,000 doses," an official at Jehangir Hospital said.

373.title: I was asked to send pictures without clothes: Ankit Siwach on casting couch
373.article_body: TV actor Ankit Siwach, who began his modelling career in Delhi 12 years ago, recently spoke about facing the casting couch. The actor admitted that coming from Meerut to Delhi was a "culture shock" for him, adding, "I was asked to send pictures without clothes." He also said, "I was asked to come to parties that weren't related to work."

374.title: Country didn't only love me, but it also hit me with shoes: Rahul
374.article_body: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Saturday commented that India not only gave him love but also hit him with shoes. "I thought why is this happening? And got the answer that the country wants to teach me...The country is telling me that you should learn, understand," he said. He made the comments at the launch of a book.

375.title: Many girls would relate to my character in 'Lost': Pia Bajpiee
375.article_body: Actress Pia Bajpiee while talking about her next film 'Lost' said many girls would relate to her character. "It touched a chord with me...She is powerful, ambitious and vulnerable at the same time," Pia added. She further said that working with director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury was like being in an institute as she learned a lot from him.

376.title: J&K ex-minister Babu Singh, absconding in Hawala case, arrested
376.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir minister Jatinder Singh alias 'Babu Singh', the main accused in a Hawala racket case that was busted by the police last month, was arrested from Kathua on Saturday. According to Jammu SSP Chandan Kohli, Jatinder Singh is being brought to Jammu for interrogation in connection to the Hawala money which was meant for subversive activities.

377.title: They weren't leaked from school or anywhere: Abhishek on pics of daughter shared online
377.article_body: On being asked how safe he feels when his daughter Aaradhya's pictures circulate on the internet with some even leaked from school, Abhishek Bachchan said, "No, they were not leaked from the school or anywhere." He added, "You'll shoot her whenever she steps out of the house. It is what it is. There is no point analysing it."

378.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for Netflix's 'Guns & Gulaabs'
378.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has completed shooting for his upcoming Netflix project titled 'Guns & Gulaabs'. "This journey wouldn't have been the same without you guys," Rajkummar wrote on Instagram while posting a picture with directors Raj Nidimoru and Krishna DK. Produced by D2R Films, 'Guns & Gulaabs' will be Rajkummar Rao's first series with Netflix.

379.title: Teammate of Kohli for a long time, first time he's so relaxed: Karthik
379.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he has been a teammate of Virat Kohli for a long time, but this is the first time Kohli is so relaxed. "There is so much time on his hands, I'm able to have long conversations," added Karthik. "I am genuinely enjoying it," stated Karthik. RCB have won two out of three IPL 2022 matches.

380.title: Delhi likely to get respite from rising temp in next 2 days: IMD
380.article_body: IMD official RK Jenamani on Saturday said that Delhi is likely to get some respite from rising temperatures in the coming two days. According to IMD, the national capital on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year. The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal.

381.title: Supply of mangoes to Pune to increase after April 20: Report
381.article_body: The supply of mangoes to Pune city is expected to improve after April 20, a Hindustan Times report said citing a trader. Due to a decline in supply this year, the prices of Ratnagiri and Devgad Alphonso mangoes range from ₹1,200 to ₹2,500 a dozen. The prices of other varieties of mango range from ₹600 to ₹1,000 a dozen.

382.title: 3 feared drowned as boat carrying 11 capsizes in river Ganga in Bihar
382.article_body: Three persons are feared drowned after a boat capsized in river Ganga near Brahmchari ghat in Bihar's Patna on Saturday. According to local residents, the small country boat carrying 11 people capsized due to high waves and strong currents. Prima facie, it appears that the boat was unable to sustain the weight of its occupants, an SDRF official said.

383.title: 13 arrested for raising anti-national slogans in Srinagar mosque
383.article_body: A total of 13 people have been arrested by Srinagar Police in the case related to anti-national and provocative sloganeering in and around Jamia Masjid, police said on Saturday. A video that surfaced on social media purportedly showed men raising Azadi slogans in the mosque. This was the first congregational prayer held in the mosque in the month of Ramzan.

384.title: Baffled by SRH's decisions, Williamson should bat at no. 3: Harbhajan
384.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said he is baffled by SRH's decision making with captain Kane Williamson opening for the franchise in IPL 2022, rather than batting at number three position. "Williamson's best numbers have come in IPL as well as for New Zealand when he has batted at number three," added Harbhajan. SRH are yet to record a win in IPL 2022.

385.title: Illegal weapons supplier held with 4 pistols in Gurugram
385.article_body: Police arrested an illegal weapon supplier and seized four pistols from him near Gurugram's Sohna. Police said they tried to stop a car coming from Sohna but the driver did not pay heed. "We somehow stopped the car and found two men inside. One of them fled as soon as the car was stopped, the other was nabbed," police said.

386.title: Avoid travelling to Shanghai due to arbitrary COVID curbs: US to citizens
386.article_body: The US has asked citizens to reconsider travel to China and avoid visiting COVID-19 hotspots, including Shanghai, due to "arbitrary enforcement" of virus restrictions amid the country's worst outbreak. The COVID-19 curbs include "the risk of parents and children being separated", the US warned. The US also authorised the "voluntary departure" of non-essential staff from its consulate in Shanghai.

387.title: Dissolve Petroleum Ministry with immediate effect: Akhilesh Yadav
387.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre over hike in fuel price and said that Central government is "robbing the people". "If no government regulations...can control this reckless hike in fuel prices, and if everything is up to the market then what is the use of Petroleum Ministry? These ministries should be shut down with immediate effect," he tweeted.

388.title: I know Rashid Khan will get me out of the worst situations: Hardik
388.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said he knows spinner Rashid Khan will help the team escape in the worst situations, adding that Rashid is his trump card. "I want batters to attack Rashid," stated Hardik. "He is an aggressive spinner which I don't see a lot," said Hardik. GT have recorded three wins in as many IPL 2022 matches.

389.title: India's 1st indigenous Polycentric Prosthetic Knee made: IIT M
389.article_body: IIT Madras researchers launched India's "first" indigenously made Polycentric Prosthetic Knee, 'Kadam'. It'll help above-knee amputees to walk with a comfortable gait. It's designed with high strength stainless steel and aluminium alloy along with hard chrome plated EN8 pins and high fatigue life polymer bushings. The Society for Biomedical Technology and Mobility India supported the development.

390.title: We sent message to Mayawati for alliance, offered CM post: Rahul
390.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that amid the Uttar Pradesh elections, his party had sent a message to BSP chief Mayawati for an alliance and offered her the CM post, but she didn't respond. He also claimed that she didn't fight for "Dalit voices" because of CBI, ED and Pegasus. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

391.title: Hope to have same equation with Alia I had with my mother-in-law: Neetu
391.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor has stated that her relationship with her mother-in-law Krishna Raj Kapoor was outstanding. She added that Krishna loved her more than her son late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor. "I hope to have the same equation with Alia because she is outstanding and amazing," Neetu said. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14.

392.title: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh to star in Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather'
392.article_body: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh has signed on to act in Chiranjeevi-starrer 'Godfather'. Chiranjeevi made the announcement on Twitter, adding that Jagannadh will be seen in a special role in the film. Helmed by Mohan Raja, 'Godfather' is the Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. The film also stars Nayanthara and Satyadev Kancharana in key roles.

393.title: Russian air strikes to increase in Ukraine's south, east: UK
393.article_body: Russian air activity is expected to increase in Ukraine's south and east, the UK's Defence Ministry said. The ministry added that "Russia is continuing to hit Ukrainian non-combatants, such as those killed in yesterday's rocket strike on Kramatorsk railway station in eastern Ukraine". At least 52 people were reportedly killed and several others were injured in Friday's railway station attack.

394.title: Insomnia could increase the risk of type 2 diabetes: Study
394.article_body: According to a study, people with insomnia are at an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes. Insomnia symptoms cause higher Hemoglobin A1C levels, indicating it plays a causal role in the condition. "Eating healthy balanced diet, being active, along with getting enough sleep, are all essential for...those at risk of, or living with, type 2 diabetes," a researcher said.

395.title: Mizoram has started issuing identity cards to Myanmar refugees: Official
395.article_body: Myanmar government has started issuing identity cards to refugees from Myanmar, a Home Department official said. "The cards will facilitate speedy...easier identification of refugees...prevent them from enrolling in the state's voters' list," the official added. A total of 29,532 Myanmarese refugees have sought shelter in Mizoram since the military takeover in February 2021, as per official data.

396.title: Covishield and Covaxin vaccine prices for private hospitals cut to ₹225 per dose
396.article_body: Serum Institute of India revised the price of Covishield vaccine for private hospitals from ₹600 to ₹225 per dose. Bharat Biotech also revised the price of Covaxin vaccine from ₹1,200 to ₹225 per dose for private hospitals. Earlier today, the Centre said, "Private COVID-19 vaccination centres can charge only up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination."

397.title: Can't be selfish to discuss Liverpool contract right now: Mo Salah
397.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has said that he can't be "selfish" to discuss his contract while the club is focused on winning trophies. "I can't be selfish and talk about my (contract)," Salah said. "We (Liverpool) are in the most important period...so I have to just talk about (Liverpool)," he added. Notably, Salah's contract expires in June 2023.

398.title: IIIT-Lucknow student gets ₹1.2 cr package with Amazon job, institute's highest-ever
398.article_body: A final year B.Tech student at Indian Institute of Information and Technology, Lucknow, has bagged the institute's highest-ever annual salary package of ₹1.2 crore. Abhijeet Dwivedi has been hired as a software development engineer for Amazon in Dublin, Ireland, TOI reported. "I saw several videos to prepare myself for the interview. Soft skills matter a lot," Dwivedi said.

399.title: Which players have hit a six off the last ball of the 20th over to win an IPL match?
399.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia became the 10th cricketer to slam a six off last delivery to win an IPL match. Rohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Saurabh Tiwary, Dwayne Bravo, MS Dhoni, Mitchell Santner, Nicholas Pooran, Ravindra Jadeja and Srikar Bharat are the other nine batters to do so. Rohit did it thrice, against KKR (2009), PWI (2011) and Deccan Chargers (2012).

400.title: Go to India if you like it so much: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter to Imran Khan
400.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Sharif has criticised Imran Khan for praising India. She tweeted, "Someone should tell a person who has gone mad after seeing this power gone that he has been expelled by his own party and no one else." She added, "If you like India so much then shift there and leave the life of Pakistan."
